story:
WHO ARE WE / QUIEN SOMOS / CHI SIAMO  

ENG.

We are two artists with a lot of ideas and small money. Uriel is an electronic music producer known as Itay. He was born in Cartgena, Murcia, on the 9th of May 1993. He wants to discover the world and enrich himself with other’s culture sounds. Arianna is a photographer and a journalist. She was born in Florence on the 7th of March 1989. She studied art, theatre and journalism and she lived and worked in various countries. After thinking about the project for a long time she met Uriel and the two of them decided to make this project come true. 

ESP. 

Somos dos artistas con mucho que ofrecer pero con pocos recursos.Uriel es un productor Español de música electrónica conocido como Itay. Nació en Cartagena, Murcia, el 9 de Mayo de 1993. Quiere registrar los sonidos del mundo y enriquecerse con otras culturas. Arianna es fotógrafa y periodista. Natural de Florencia, nació el 7 de Marzo de 1989. Estudió historia del Arte, Teatro y Periodismo y ha vivido a la vez que trabajado en varios países. Después de barajar mucho la idea de este proyecto se encontró con Uriel y los dos decidieron llevar a cabo la iniciativa.

ITA. 

Siamo due artisti con molte idee e pochi fondi. Uriel è un produttore di musica elettronica conosciuto come Itay. Nasce a Cartagena, Murcia, il 9 Maggio 1993. Vuole scoprire il mondo e arricchirsi con i suoni di altre culture. Arianna è fotografa e giornalista. Originaria di Firenze, nata il 7 Marzo 1989. Ha studiato arte, teatro e giornalismo e ha vissuto e lavorato in vari paesi. Dopo aver pensato a lungo in questo progetto incontrò Uriel e i due hanno deciso di portare a termine questa idea.  


THE PROJECT / EL PROYECTO/ IL PROGETTO  

ENG. 

Roots rise from the willing of preserve the folkloric culture. Everything that doesn’t fit in the official culture.  The gestures, the music, the roots of civilization. That ancestral heritage that is at risk to be loosed.  We want to be the intermediate between tradition and modernity. Collect histories, songs, traditions and show them to modern society. Try to make the new generations remember their roots. This project doesn’t rises from nostalgia o simple fascination for the folklore, it raises from our belief that it’s important to not forget where we came from, who we are, our background. We strongly believe that to let new ideas grown it’s vitally important to know the cultural background. Modern society normally believes that the development consists in change the old with something new. We think that the best thing to do is not simply renovate but connect new ideas with the old ones. Create something new complementing and not replacing.  

ESP. 

Roots nace de la voluntad de preservar el folklore. Todo lo que no cabe en la cultura oficial. Aquel patrimonio atávico que esta en riesgo de perderse.
La base principal de Roots es la de ser el intermediario entre tradición y modernidad. Coleccionar las diferencias entre culturas como pueden ser los gestos típicos, las historias, la música, las danzas, los rituales que no conocemos... mostrarlos a la sociedad actual e intentar que las nuevas generaciones no se olviden de éstas. El proyecto no surge de la nostalgia o solamente por el amor al folklore, si no porque creemos que es fundamental no olvidar de donde venimos, quienes somos y nuestras raíces. Pensamos que para concienciarnos es de vital importancia conocer las bases de las tradiciones y poder empatizar con ellas. Tendemos a pensar que evolucionar es renovar lo antiguo por algo nuevo, pero nuestro concepto es que lo mejor no es sustituir, si no complementar y preservar. 

ITA.

Roots nasce dalla voglia di preservare la cultura non scritta. Tutto ciò che non trova spazio nella cultura officiale. I gesti, i rituali, la musica. Le radici delle civiltà. Quel patrimonio folklorico che rischia di perdersi. Vogliamo essere il tramite tra tradizione e modernità. Raccogliere le storie, le canzoni e le tradizioni e farle vedere al mondo. Fare in modo che le nuove generazioni non si scordino delle proprie radici. Vogliamo farlo non per nostalgia o semplice amore per il folklore ma perché crediamo sia fondamentale non dimenticare da dove veniamo, chi siamo, le nostre radici. Pensiamo che perché possano nascer nuove idee sia di vitale importanza conoscere le basi della tradizione. La modernità non deve sostituire la tradizione ma fondersi con essa. 

THE PLAN / EL PLAN / IL PIANO


ENG. 

We will travel the world backpacking passing through Asia, South America and Europe and we will get in touch with the untouched part of the civilization, that part that still keep alive the spirit of tradition.  Our idea is to travel through Asia, South America and Europe and record the folkloric soul of the countries.  We are going to document it with visual (photography and videos), audio and written form.  One year and something is our estimated travel time to collect all this information and during that time you will be able to follow us in our blog.  The final part of the project will consist in trying to meld the cultural heritage with new trends, modern technologies and the input of our era.  

ESP. 

Recorreremos parte del mundo con la mochila a la espalda para entrar en contacto con la parte menos contaminada de civilizaciones, aquella parte que sigue manteniendo vivo el espíritu de la tradición. Nuestra idea es viajar por Asia, América del Sur y Europa recopilando la esencia de los países. Todo esto será documentado en forma de audio, visual (fotografía, vídeo) y escrita. Un año y medio es nuestro tiempo aproximado para reunir toda esta información y podréis seguir todo el viaje en nuestro blog.
La parte final del proyecto será dedicada a la experimentación artística. Como el patrimonio arcaico se puede fusionar con las nuevas tendencias, la tecnología y con los estímulos de nuestra era. 

ITA. 

Vogliamo viaggiare per il mondo zaino in spalla per entrare in contatto con la parte più incontaminata delle varie civiltà, quella parte che continua a mantenere vivo lo spirito delle tradizioni.  La nostra idea è viaggiare attraverso Asia, Sud America e Europa e collezionare la anima folklorica di questi paesi. Documenteremo il viaggio in forma di audio, visiva (fotografie e video) e scritta. Un anno e mezzo è, approssimativamente, il tempo che utilizzeremo per raccogliere le informazioni e durante questo periodo potrete seguirci sul nostro blog.  La parte finale del progetto sarà dedicata a vedere come il patrimonio tradizionale si pu  integrare con la modernità, con le nuove tecnologie e gli stimoli della società attuale.  


THE TEAM / El EQUIPO / LA SQUADRA 


ENG.

Uriel will take care of the music part. With his recorder he is going to collect the sounds, the songs and the typical music of the countries that we are going to visit. Arianna will deal with the visual and written part. She will photograph, make videos and write.   

ESP. 

Uriel se va a encargar de la parte musical. Con su grabadora va a recopilar todos los sonidos, las canciones y la música típica de los países que visitemos. Arianna se ocupará de la parte visual y escrita. Va a fotografiar, grabar vídeos y escribir las historias relacionadas tanto con el proyecto como las anécdotas del viaje.  

 ITA.

Uriel si occuperà della parte musicale. Con il suo registratore collezionerà i suoni, le canzoni e la musica tipica dei luoghi che visiteremo. Arianna si occuperà della parte visuale e scritta. Farà foto, registrerà video e scriverà.  

 

THE BUDGET / EL PRESUPUESTO / IL PREVENTIVO 

ENG. 

We are asking you 6000 euros. A big amount, we know.  We we’ll use it to buy tickets, insurance and some of the gear that we need. From our side we are working as hard as we can to save money.   

ESP.

El presupuesto necesario estimado son 6000 euros. Es una gran cantidad, somos consciente de ello. El dinero se utilizará para la compra de los billetes, el seguro de viaje y parte del equipo necesario. Por nuestra parte estamos trabajando duramente para ahorrar lo máximo posible y conseguir nuestro objetivo. 

ITA. 

Stiamo chiedendo 6000 euro. Una grande somma, lo sappiamo. La utilizzeremo per compare I biglietti, l’assicurazione e parte dell’attrezzatura di cui abbiamo bisogno. Da parte nostra stiamo lavorando più duramente possibile per risparmiare.    


FINAL PRODUCT / PRODOTTO FINALE / PRODUCTO FINAL

ENG.

All the information collected (photographs, sounds, histories and videos) could be used to write articles in magazines, in television and radio shows, photo exhibition, conferences, books...etc.
Moreover, during the journey we could give interviews and take part in radio, television and web shows.

ESP.

Toda la información recopilada durante la realización del proyecto (fotografías, sonidos, historias y videos) se podrá utilizar para la redacción de artículos en revistas especializadas, inserción en programas televisivos y de radiodifusión, exposiciones fotográficas, conferencias, libros...etc.

Además, durante el viaje concederíamos entrevistas y participaríamos en tertulias para programas radiofónicos, televisivos y/o en la web.

ITA.

Tutte le informazioni raccolte durante il viaggio (fotografie, i suoni, le storie e i video) potranno essere utilizzati per la stesura di articoli su riviste specializzate, inserimento in programmi televisivi, mostre fotografiche, conferenze, libri...etc. Inoltre durante il viaggio potremmo rilasciare interviste e prendere parte a programmi radiofonici, televisivi e/o nel web. 


HOW YOU CAN HELP / COMO PUEDES AYUDAR / COME AIUTARCI  

ENG.

If you can help us with a little money you make us very, VERY, happy of course. But if you can't you can help us spread the love! 

Here you have some examples:  

- share this crowd funding campaign with all your contacts. 

- like our Facebook page. 

- visit our website. 

- sponsor us (we will appreciate every kind of sponsor...from technical gear to energetic food to clothes. Whenever you want!) 

- visit our online shop (MagicalBeetle) 

Do everything that can help us been noticed.  

Oh and always remember to send us good vibes, it's free! :)  


ESP.

Si puedes ayudarnos con una pequeña aportación económica nos harías muy, pero MUY felices, por supuesto. Pero si no puedes, ayúdanos a difundir esta campaña. Spread the love!

Unos ejemplos de cómo puedes hacerlo:

- compartir nuestra campaña de crowd funding con todos tus contactos. 

- dar “Like” a nuestra pagina Facebook 

- visitar nuestro sito web 

- sponsorizarnos (apreciaríamos cualquier tipo de sponsor...equipo técnico, alimentación, ropa. Cualquier cosa!)

- visita nuestra tienda online (MagicalBeetle) 

O cualquier otra cosa que pueda dar a conocer nuestro proyecto

Y recuerda enviarnos buenas vibraciones, esto es gratis! :) 


ITA. 

Se potessi aiutarci con un aiuto economico ci fareste molto, MOLTO, felici. Se non puoi, aiutaci a diffondere questa campagna. Spread the love! 

Alcuni esempi di cosa puoi fare:  

- condividi la nostra campagna di crowd funding con tutti i tuoi contatti. 

- dai “mi piace” alla nostra pagina Facebook. 

- visita il nostro sito web.

- sponsorizzaci (apprezzeremmo qualunque tipo di sponsor...attrezzatura tecnica, cibo, vestiti. Qualunque cosa!)  

- visita il nostro negozio online (MagicalBeetle)  

Fai qualunque cosa possa aiutarci a far conoscere il nostro progetto.   

E ricordati di inviarci vibrazioni positive, è gratis! :)

story: If you're reading this, then you haven't heard... thanks to everyone's generosity, I have MORE than reached my goal.  PUT YOUR WALLET AWAY!  Thank you so much!
story_txt: If you're reading this, then you haven't heard... thanks to everyone's generosity, I have MORE than reached my goal.  PUT YOUR WALLET AWAY!  Thank you so much!

story:
THE WEST COAST LEAGUE OF LADY WRESTLERS (WCLOLW) presents:

♥⚡⚡THE VELVET RUT RUMBLE⚡⚡♥

April 23rd 2016 ♥ Victoria Edelweiss Club Hall ♥ 108 Niagara Street, Victoria B.C.


What is the WCLOLW?

Inspired by the spectacle that is inherent to professional wrestling, we are an art collective formed in celebration of feminine identities and subversion of traditional gender roles and expectations.

The League Of Lady Wrestlers was founded by artists with a common desire to explore the intersections between performance and the male gaze in visual culture. The West Coast League Of Lady Wrestlers is the newest baby sister of our wild, weird and wonderful family. Compiled by artists from various backgrounds living on Vancouver Island and the British Columbia Mainland, we collaborate to craft our performances in the spirit of spectacle sports, humour and the accessibility of art.


⚡What We Need & What You Get⚡

We are hoping to raise $2500. This will go towards:

♥   Renting our venue - We have chosen to host the Velvet Rut Rumble at the Victoria Edelweiss Club Hall. It's not easy to find a venue willing to host a wrestling match, nor is it cheap! $1000 will go towards the hall rental including insurance, taxes and fees.

♥   Renting our ring - The cost to rent our wrestling ring is $1000. Renting a proper wrestling ring is a safer alternative than building our own.

♥   The extra funds will go towards the cost of printing our promotional material and tickets, renting film and sound equipment, contributions for the band, videographers and photographers, and our liquor license.

What you can get:

♥   A personalized headshot from your favourite wrestler. You can specify who you would like to receive a message from or it can be a surprise! This will be mailed to you after the event or can be collected at the merchandise table at the Velvet Rut Rumble.

♥  A limited-edition set of WCLOLW trading cards featuring all of our wrestlers!

♥   Tickets to the match (guaranteed seats!)

♥   A limited edition WCLOLW Velvet Rut Rumble t-shirt designed and hand-printed by our very own Grant Hash.

♥   VIP Luxury ring-side seating featuring table service by recently liberated garden gnome Furious Featherbrain as well as one-on-one meet and greet time with the wrestlers.

♥   A great feeling in your heart!



    ⚡⚡The Impact⚡⚡

    We are a group of working-class mortals, performers, artists and students. In the ring we are unapologetically brash, brave, gross, loud, smelly, funny and exuberant. We are bitches and heroines. We are loveable and not likeable. We support each other in these choices. 

    Unfortunately, this kind of raucous entertainment requires a start-up capital that is above the capabilities of our combined working-class pay-cheques.

    Your contribution will help us get this chapter of our organization established, and allow us to

    ♥   Promote and embrace justice in gender equity

    ♥   Keep our events affordable so they are accessible to our community

    ♥   Expand upon our already successful League Of Lady Wrestlers events

    Anyone who has attended League Of Lady Wrestlers events can attest to the amount of work that went into putting on our shows with very little resources. 

    We hope with a little bit of funding under our championship belts we can make the West Coast League of Lady Wrestlers events a bi-annual occurrence!


    ⚡⚡! Risks + Challenges !⚡⚡

    We have received an enormous amount of support throughout our LOLW herstory, however this West Coast chapter of the league is in the infant stages of developing on new turf. The WCLOLW is currently an unregistered art collective and depends on crowd-sourced funding, small grants available to grassroots arts and social justice organizations and our personal funds. In order to qualify for larger arts grants available in British Columbia such as the CRD Arts Development and BC Arts Council, we must be registered as a non-profit artist collective. This registration is a lengthy process that can take a couple years of balanced budgets, exhibition history, and representation from registered non-profit arts societies and members of Pacific Association of Artist Run Centres.

    Our first show on the West Coast is a very bold and risky D.I.Y. project! Our success depends on the countless hours our devoted performers, organizers and volunteers generously donate to the league. But we believe it's worth it!

    League Of Lady Wrestlers events are more than just a simple battles between faces and heels. Our audacious, dynamic spectacles invite every participant to celebrate the desire to push back against oppressive cultural values. We join together to suspend disbelief and hold on to optimism about the possibilities of empowerment, gender equity, and community.



    ⚡⚡Other Ways You Can Help⚡⚡

    Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help!

    ♥   Tell everyone you know! We are always looking for keen event volunteers, collaborators and a bigger audience. SHARE SHARE SHARE.

    ♥   Come to the Velvet Rut Rumble!



    More about ⚡⚡THE VELVET RUT RUMBLE⚡⚡

    Featuring wrestlers from the League Of Lady Wrestlers Toronto, the Dawson City League Of Lady Wrestlers and some fresh local talent, the VELVET RUT RUMBLE will showcase elaborate entrances, fierce fights, dramatic rivalries and surprise guests that will SHAKE YOUR VELVET RUT TO THE CORE!

    $15 ADVANCE | $20 DOOR (space permitting)
    The Victoria Edelweiss Club Hall (108 Niagara Street, Victoria, British Columbia)
    DOORS 7pm | 1st MATCH 8pm


    ♥♥THE ROSTER♥♥

    BLACK WIDOW ~ Emerging from the dark, dank and feared corners of intricately woven independence, this shapeshifter has been hailed both Demon and Goddess throughout history. Scrutinized for her hungry goals, her emotional autonomy and sexual cannibalism, legend has named her Jorōgumo, Arachne, a Spinnetod, and many others. Tired of the stories that have fetishized her power, Black Widow emerges in her true form to weave a new herstorical saga. Be weary of her sneaky spidey-senses, subtle moves and crafty agility, for this wild witch isn't on the hunt; she waits.

    QUAGGA MUSCLES ~ A close relative of the Zebra Mussel, Quagga is an invasive species that hails from the black sea. She has infested waters far and wide with her parasitic privilege. The strength of her stronghold has been known to choke all forms of life out an entire aquatic ecosystems. Her razor sharp shell can slice through even the fanciest gum boot. Her wretched Siren song induces paralytic seizures in her cursed opponents.

    HAGATHA CRISPY ~ mystery novelist and editor by day, gentrification fighter by night! She lives alone in an old mansion on the water. Her elderly neighbors have all passed away and their children have sold the land to an evil developer for it’s increasing high value. But Agatha knows she’ll be alive for a while yet and fully intends to stay put. Agatha knows of a brewing plan to replace her home and the quaint seaside land, filled with trees and their wild inhabitants, in favour of a large luxury condo development on land stripped of it’s native flora and fauna.

    JEAN SPAWNDA ~ Hailing from the deepest aquatic caves of the ninth planet, this slime sucking, collarbone crushing alien badass is here on earth for one reason: TOTAL DOMINATION. Her unearthly band of female warriors, the CLITERATTI have a lust for impregnating their enemies with their signature oozing slime. Don't let her get you in a hold or you'll find yourself waking up to a bellyful of extraterrestrial spawn.

    INNA DEMON ~ Years can pass between sightings, and just when you begin to doubt their existence, this malevolent being will appear seemingly out of nowhere, and will drag you down. They are known for their vicious cycles of self loathing and social anxiety, masked by an exterior of binge drinking, reckless behavior and loud living - often with an unapologetic, angry demeanor. When your life is trash they will be there.

    STEEL KEGAL ~  a master of discipline, having spent her whole fighting career guarding her most prized weapon: her virginity. Painstakingly preventing her precious flower from being sullied has allowed her to amass an incredible amount of pent-up energy that she unleashes at a moments notice on whoever dares cross her. Her signature move, the hymen maneuver, looks much like a reach-around grab but she insists that "its all in the hymen". Opponents have long tried to pop her cherry (which looks very much like a red helium balloon that she carries with her) with the hope that this will allow her to chill out already, thereby sapping her power.

    ANNACONDO ~ Slithered out of the womb half woman, half snake and all business, this omnibreed is a self-made, set for life real estate mogul. She wrestles to pacify her insatiable predatory nature and when she can, for deeds. This duplicitous, walking, kicking snake-woman constricts the power from her opponents just as she strangles the affordability out of working class neighborhoods. She has no qualms with displacing people, or body their parts.

    URSA MAJOR ~ Hailing from the celestial heavens of the northern 'sphere this mama bear is anything but an angel. Drawing strength sevenfold from her asterism stars, this brash bear will dip & rip more fiercely than a thicket of Devil's Club. Roaming the western skies, Ursa seeks to maul trophy hunting males who celebrate their kill of fierce grizzly women. She's been healing during a long winter hibernation; now awake and ready for murderous rancor on the dude-bros who colonize the landscape and rape for their trophy hunting sport. Bear witness to Ursa's truculency as she wades heavily in the water of the Salish Sea, waiting for the west coast brawl to commence. Ursa's tracking the patriarchal trophy; the hunted has become the hunter.

    MEDOUCHEA ~ After being victim-blamed for a series of sexual assaults over a lifetime in the underworld, Medouchea has one goal and one goal only: the eternal quest for revenge on all douchebaggery. Blinded by bitterness, her wrath extends basically to anything that moves. Womanizers of the world beware – she’s got extra-special loathing for your type and legend has it her douche will immobilize you. She’s a true villain. Every ounce of goodness has been rinsed right out of her. Now this one’s thirsty for death squadding.

    PANDORA DEATH BOX ~ Pandora Death Box has finally escaped the domesticated sphere of her crabby Scottish husband. Returning to the sacred muir as her old Selkie sea witch self, Pandora Death Box is on a mission to reclaim the many sealskins of her lost sisters despite the claustrophobic restrictions of patriarchy and its many prescribed boxes. Awaiting her prey in beds of bull kelp, she watches for any crusty oppressor creeping the shoreline. Fuelled by her Selkie ancestors, Pandora Death Box uses her transformative power to shapeshift and her deep emotional rage to mobilize oceanic whirlpools of DOOM. Tangling her opponents into Celtic knots of fury and blissfully whipping their booties, she attempts to release the sheer evil out of any unwelcome visitor. Watch out for her seaweed and crude oil upchuck when she barks. The aroma is foul and toxic...

    SHAYENA ~ Born from a long dominant matriarchal lineage, Shyena grew up in the dusty trails of a merciless savana. Female spotted hyenas are not like other hyenas, they're dominance over males grew them a pseudo-penis to show their supremacy. Being the largest and strongest of her species with a bear-like built she is bloodthirsty and on the hunt for her next prey at any given time, licking her fangs at the sight of any warmblooded critter that dares enter her territory. Dryhumping males facefront and viciously attacking her female subordinates, to remind them of her dominance, is common nature. Recently captured by a safari game hunter The backwoods breeder she is now chained and can't contained her wild instinct to kill.

    CROTCH LIGHT ~ From the land of sparkle clits and snail trails, Crotchlight is the inner essence that every strong broad is capable of. Once tapped into, Crotchlight releases her signature moves, the labia smack and her blinding death beam of lazer light current originating from her crotch.

    MACHO HAM ~ A hangry, hustlin’, heartbreakin’ hater, Macho Ham is there to put the hurt on and give you a hard on. This haggard hambone is macho as rock - and won’t let you forget it. Hamming it up hard and slamming it down harder.  Macho Ham can handle herself in the ring, but you should see her handle a pair of Bacon Titz - Come on out Bacon Bitties, show us your tithes! With spit in her eye and fire in her teeth, Macho Ham will show you who’s the man. This ‘aint honey-glazed ham - it’s wrestling.


    AND MORE...


    #WCLOLW

    #VELVETRUTRUMBLE
story_txt:
THE WEST COAST LEAGUE OF LADY WRESTLERS (WCLOLW) presents: 

♥⚡⚡THE VELVET RUT RUMBLE⚡⚡♥
April 23rd 2016 ♥ Victoria Edelweiss Club Hall ♥ 108 Niagara Street, Victoria B.C.

What is the WCLOLW?
 Inspired by the spectacle that is inherent to professional wrestling, we are an art collective formed in celebration of feminine identities and subversion of traditional gender roles and expectations.
The League Of Lady Wrestlers was founded by artists with a common desire to explore the
 intersections between performance and the male gaze in visual culture. The West Coast League Of Lady Wrestlers is the 
newest baby sister of our wild, weird and wonderful family. Compiled by 
artists from various backgrounds living on Vancouver Island and
 the British Columbia Mainland, we collaborate to craft our performances
 in the spirit of spectacle sports, humour and the accessibility of art.

  
⚡What We Need & What You Get⚡ We are hoping to raise $2500. This will go towards:
 ♥   Renting our venue - We have chosen to host the Velvet Rut Rumble at the Victoria Edelweiss Club Hall. It's not easy to find a venue willing to host a wrestling match, nor is it cheap! $1000 will go towards the hall rental including insurance, taxes and fees.
♥   Renting our ring - The cost to rent our wrestling ring is $1000. Renting a proper wrestling ring is a safer alternative than building our own. 
♥   The extra funds will go towards the cost of printing our promotional 
material and tickets, renting film and sound equipment, contributions for the band, videographers and photographers, and our liquor license.

What you can get:
♥   A personalized headshot from your favourite wrestler. You can
 specify who you would like to receive a message from or it can be a surprise! This will be mailed to you after the event or can be collected at the merchandise table at the Velvet Rut Rumble. 
♥  A limited-edition set of WCLOLW trading cards featuring all of our wrestlers!
♥   Tickets to the match (guaranteed seats!)
♥   A limited edition WCLOLW Velvet Rut Rumble t-shirt designed and hand-printed by our very own Grant Hash. 
♥   VIP Luxury ring-side seating featuring table service by recently liberated garden gnome Furious Featherbrain as well as one-on-one meet and greet time with the 
wrestlers.
♥   A great feeling in your heart!
 
   
⚡⚡The Impact⚡⚡ 
We are a group of working-class mortals, performers, artists and students. In the ring we are unapologetically brash, brave, gross, loud, smelly, funny and exuberant. We are bitches and heroines. We are loveable and not likeable. We support each other in these choices.  
Unfortunately, this kind of raucous entertainment requires a start-up capital that is above the capabilities of our combined working-class pay-cheques. 
Your contribution will help us get this chapter of our organization established, and allow us to
♥   Promote and embrace justice in gender equity
♥   Keep our events affordable so they are accessible to our community
♥   Expand upon our already successful League Of Lady Wrestlers events
Anyone
 who has attended League Of Lady Wrestlers events can attest to the amount of work that 
went into putting on our shows with very little resources. 
We hope with a little bit of funding under our championship belts we can make the West Coast League of Lady Wrestlers events a bi-annual occurrence! 



⚡⚡! Risks + Challenges !⚡⚡
We have received an enormous amount of support throughout our LOLW herstory, however this West Coast chapter of the league is in the infant stages of developing on new turf. The WCLOLW is currently an unregistered art collective and depends on 
crowd-sourced funding, small grants available to grassroots arts and 
social justice organizations and our personal funds. In order to qualify for larger arts grants available in British Columbia such as the CRD Arts Development and BC Arts Council, we must be registered as a non-profit artist collective. This registration is a lengthy process that can take a couple years of balanced budgets, exhibition history, and representation from registered non-profit arts societies and members of Pacific Association of Artist Run Centres. 
Our first show on the West Coast is a very bold and risky D.I.Y. project! Our success depends on the countless hours our devoted performers, organizers and volunteers generously donate to the league. But we believe it's worth it! 
League Of Lady Wrestlers events are more than just a simple battles between faces and heels. Our audacious, dynamic spectacles invite every participant to celebrate the desire to push back against oppressive cultural values. We join together to suspend disbelief and hold on to optimism about the possibilities of empowerment, gender equity, and community.




⚡⚡Other Ways You Can Help⚡⚡
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help!
♥   Tell everyone you know! We are always looking for keen event volunteers, collaborators and a bigger audience. SHARE SHARE SHARE.
♥   Come to the Velvet Rut Rumble! 


More about ⚡⚡THE VELVET RUT RUMBLE⚡⚡


Featuring wrestlers from the League Of Lady Wrestlers Toronto, the Dawson City League Of Lady Wrestlers and some fresh local talent, the VELVET RUT RUMBLE will showcase elaborate entrances, fierce fights, dramatic rivalries and surprise guests that will SHAKE YOUR VELVET RUT TO THE CORE!

story:
Summary

I am passionate about the arts and life and my work is concerned with experiences that pass the thresholds of intellect and emotion. In addition to being an award winning artist, performer and musician, I study and research on behavioural transformation; I am a coach and professional facilitator and member of the Mindfulness Association UK. I feel honoured to be collaborating with brilliant artists, scientists, musicians and performers, with The Koppel Project cultural centre (London, UK) and the Skironio Museum Polychronopoulos (Attica, Greece). Alongside their support, I have been self-funding a big part of my research and practice and now need all the help I can get to take the project further.

 

Link to The Koppel Project (Baker street, London) website: http://thekoppelproject.com/elefsis-minotaur-arrival/

ELEFSIS (means 'Arrival' in Greek) is a site-specific performance experience that uses art/visuals, sound/music, dance theatre, words and interaction to challenge participants’ perceptual systems. The audience is a key part of the work; this piece will be inspiring participants discover interesting aspects of themselves. It is a work in progress and part of ongoing research on human perception, ambiguity, dislocation and the Rites of Passage. It brings together attitudes of play, curiosity, mindfulness and sharing, and concepts from Augusto Boal's educational Theatre and Plato's writings on Antique Greek Tragedy and Rites. Your support is crucial for enabling this research to progress and for ELEFSIS to be initially showcased in London, UK  and Athens, Greece. Feedback from the initial shows will inform and transform this work going forward.

The experience uses the concept of the Minotaur as a starting point and focuses on the moment that the creature arrives at the Labyrinth. Each participant is, at the same time, a visitor and a Minotaur and their labyrinth is both a physical and mental operational frame. A number of sensory stimuli, acts and games throughout the performance lead or enable each participant to make choices and this is the point where the experience becomes totally subjective and open to diverse narratives and interpretations. The piece aims to initiate a self-discovery and put forward questions such as:

  • What is the relationship of Presence and Absence and how it defines my experiences?
  • How can I deal with a sense of constant move and ambiguity – how does this influence my perception and mental state?
  • Let’s say I am arriving in a place, a time-frame, a relationship or a goal; arriving in life itself. How do I deal with the act of being here? What is the reality that I chose to experience and how my choice shapes my relationship with myself and others? Where am I really, right now?

 

What We Need & What You Get

Structure: The piece is a promenade in five rooms/stages; Each room has its unique visual and sound installation. Five performers, including myself, will be interacting with the audience. In London, the experience is designed for 18 people at a time, given the specifics of the venue. In Greece, the number of audience/participants per each performance will grow as space is bigger. The site-specific nature of ELEFSIS allows it to adapt to any given space and environment.

Although I have limited funds, I am determined not only to present a work of high caliber but also to pay my fellow artists/performers for their contribution. Your backing will allow me to do that and to also create a good quality video documentation that will help me to seek further support from arts organisations and festivals.

In essence, funds will go to:

60% Production costs UK & Greece (including all kinds of material) & video costs

30% artists/performers initial remuneration

10% admin & marketing

If the campaign exceeds its goal, then any additional fund will go towards travel expenses for the whole team to deliver the show in Greece, in 2018.

If the campaign does not reach its full goal it will still help me, as will subsidise for part of the existing costs and I will be forever grateful! Any help is much appreciated.

PERKS!

We've prepared unique perks for you - including the opportunity to experience this project first hand. Here's a list of perks:

1) Reserving a place to watch/experience the initial show in London (world premiere), on 22 & 23 September 2017 + handout/memoir pack.

 

2) An ELEFSIS poster (21 x 59 cm) signed by the artist

 

3) A copy of my book 'What about Art if not about Transformation?' due to be released in December 2017

 

4) A quality print (45 x 140cm) of the 'Encounter' - the original artwork used in the show, signed by the artist. Prints are numbered and limited to 10.

 

5) The original artwork 'Encounter'! Dimensions: 45cm x 140cm on paper and hand made paper.

(image as above)

 

6) Original small coloured sketches, created during the preparation of the piece, signed by the artist - between A4 and A5

 

7) Original artwork titled 'Point Zero' (32 cm x 44.5cm), signed by the artist.

 

8) A special original artwork titled 'My Dragon totem' (30cm x 100cm)  signed by the artist

 

8) 3 live web coaching sessions on creativity with Katerina Barampouti

Risks & Challenges

I trust and hope we will all be in good health; apart from that and from any unforeseen events such as earthquakes, we are determined to realise this project and share a truly meaningful and useful experience with the audience! In case of emergency, we are flexible and able to reschedule the presentation dates.

I have been putting together big, complex events (i.e. a 30 multidisciplinary artists exhibition in the framework of the Beijing Cultural Olympics) and feel confident that I can organise this one smoothly. I am also sensitive to environmental and humanitarian issues; wherever possible (and meaning wherever I have access to the information and at the best of my knowledge) I use eco-friendly, fair trade material (this might cost more money in the short term but gives great benefits in the long run). I hope you do share these values with me.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute please do not worry! There are other ways you can help me:

  • Spread the word! Share this campaign with your networks and friends - and make some good buzz about it!
  • Like the 'ELEFSIS: Minotaur Arrival' Page on Facebook, comment on it, support its visibility! Link:https://www.facebook.com/KaterinaBarampouti/?hc_ref=ARShygmZxWohJyyDGFQfkh6ZoAyhJq4o2-QHiujt21uJTWA5nvxSm6hWUPBqbYr06GQ&fref=nf&pnref=story
  • Follow me on Twitter, Linkdn
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

A big thanks to all!

If the campaign does not reach its full goal it will still help me, as will subsidise for part of the existing costs and I will be forever grateful! Any help is much appreciated.
PERKS!
We've prepared unique perks for you - including the opportunity to experience this project first hand. Here's a list of perks:
1) Reserving a place to watch/experience the initial show in London (world premiere), on 22 & 23 September 2017 + handout/memoir pack.

 
2) An ELEFSIS poster (21 x 59 cm) signed by the artist

 
3) A copy of my book 'What about Art if not about Transformation?' due to be released in December 2017

 
4) A quality print (45 x 140cm) of the 'Encounter' - the original artwork used in the show, signed by the artist. Prints are numbered and limited to 10.

 
5) The original artwork 'Encounter'! Dimensions: 45cm x 140cm on paper and hand made paper.
(image as above)
 
6) Original small coloured sketches, created during the preparation of the piece, signed by the artist - between A4 and A5

 
7) Original artwork titled 'Point Zero' (32 cm x 44.5cm), signed by the artist.

 
8) A special original artwork titled 'My Dragon totem' (30cm x 100cm)  signed by the artist

 
8) 3 live web coaching sessions on creativity with Katerina Barampouti

Risks & Challenges

I trust and hope we will all be in good health; apart from that and from any unforeseen events such as earthquakes, we are determined to realise this project and share a truly meaningful and useful experience with the audience! In case of emergency, we are flexible and able to reschedule the presentation dates.
I have been putting together big, complex events (i.e. a 30 multidisciplinary artists exhibition in the framework of the Beijing Cultural Olympics) and feel confident that I can organise this one smoothly. I am also sensitive to environmental and humanitarian issues; wherever possible (and meaning wherever I have access to the information and at the best of my knowledge) I use eco-friendly, fair trade material (this might cost more money in the short term but gives great benefits in the long run). I hope you do share these values with me.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute please do not worry! There are other ways you can help me:

Spread the word! Share this campaign with your networks and friends - and make some good buzz about it!
Like the 'ELEFSIS: Minotaur Arrival' Page on Facebook, comment on it, support its visibility! Link:https://www.facebook.com/KaterinaBarampouti/?hc_ref=ARShygmZxWohJyyDGFQfkh6ZoAyhJq4o2-QHiujt21uJTWA5nvxSm6hWUPBqbYr06GQ&fref=nf&pnref=story

Follow me on Twitter, Linkdn
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

A big thanks to all!

story:
CALLING ALL RISD ALUMNI TO SHOW YOUR CREATIVITY AND SUPPORT THIS PROJECT!

We want to put a blank skull in the hands of our talented community to see just how creative you can get.

Get One!  Share One!  Paint One!

Day of the Alumni is a project developed to raise money for the Rhode Island School of Design scholarship fund and awareness for the Rhode Island School of Design Alumni Association. To do this we plan to embrace the popularity of the DIY phenomenon in the Maker Movement to encourage RISD Alumni around the globe to express themselves artistically within a creative theme.

This project is also inspired by another tradition, growing in popularity around the world, which is Dia de Los Muertos or Day of the Dead. This holiday honors those who have come before in a positive and very artistic light. Most recognizable of the decorations is the Sugar Skull and it is there that we build our idea.

The Day of the Alumni project will make a blank Sugar Skull available to interested Alumni that wish to participate.

This campaign runs until the Day of the Dead and then these artists and designers will decorate their skull however they like - creating expressive works of art over the next year. Completed skulls will be exhibited online and on the Day of the Alumni  at the 2016 RISD by Design weekend. 

Having excitement around this collaborative undertaking will allow us to share the message of what the Alumni Association is and to help raise money for the Rhode Island School of Design scholarship fund.

Funds raised here on Indiegogo will go towards:

  • Production of the blank skulls
  • Perk fulfilment and fees
  • Packaging materials
  • Supporting items for Alumni Club painting parties
After molds are created the skulls will be produced in a lightweight, paintable, toxic-free, vinyl. This is the same as you will find with similar DIY sculptures.

Additional proceeds raised will be donated to the RISD Scholarship fund.

Perks for Friends

For those who are friends and want to support this creative endevour select a perk to get one of these painted skulls or buy blanks to make sure a RISD artist gets their hands on it.

Perks for RISD Alumni

If you are a RISD Alumn and wish to paint a skull you can select a number of the perks that include a blank skull. Please consider selecting a perk that includes additional skulls for other students and alumni.

Thank You!

On behalf of the RISD Alumni Association we would like to thank you for supporting this project.

Please share this page with your networks and spread art. #RISDskulls paint one!

story:
Update:  8/6/2015

Wow!  150% funded at our close.  Thank you generous donors!  Our campaign is now In Demand which means we can still accept donations before we head out to playa.
Thanks to this amazing community, we have closed our budget shortfall, and are looking to raise only about $5000 to complete the project.  If you can give, or know someone who can, please help us out.
See you in the dust!
~ Dreamers Guild



Update: 7/28/2015

We are so close to hitting our $30k stretch goal - only $3500 to go.  Please help!


Update: 7/21/2015

We hit our minimum campaign goal of $20k in only six days! Thank you!

Now we need to push to our final goal of $50k.

We cannot wait to bring this beautiful Temple to playa and give it to the city.

Let's keep this momentum going! 

Help us hit $30,000 before the campaign closes and we will include an additional sticker and a special vial of ash from the Temple after the event to all of our donors, at any level.

Thank you for your donations and thank you for sharing this project. 

This Temple burns in 47 days

The Temple of Promise...

As we launch this campaign, the man will burn in 52 days. The Temple will burn in 53. The journey to this point has been one full of collaboration, learning, and incredible achievement. We carry all these lessons forward with us in these final days, hours, and minutes before we head to playa. We also carry a deep appreciation for the people, like you, who enable us to give this gift to the community.

Many of the elegant arches that comprise the Temple are finished and await transport to the playa. Construction of the rest is charging forward on schedule at an exciting pace. We have the processes and the know-how to build them and incredible momentum from our beautiful, dedicated volunteers. With a crew like ours, there is little that can hold us back, but we need help overcoming our last financial hurdle. Giving now ensures that the Temple of Promise reaches its full potential; becomes an awe-inspiring structure that will amaze even the builders now so intimate with its individual parts. 

The Burning Man Arts Honorarium grant was the seed that got us started, but every temple crew is responsible for raising the lion’s share of the funds necessary to purchase materials and tools needed to build the Temple, transport it to the playa, and support our on-playa team as they erect your temple, the Temple of Promise. We believe that it is a boon to the community that it is our collective responsibility to raise these funds and we are proud to reach out to you for help.

 

How much does the Temple cost?

Wood & other materials ($152,000):  The beautiful untreated poplar we are using was selected for its aesthetic, quality and economy, and this Temple uses a LOT of it. 32 Temple arches of increasing size are connected by over 2.5 miles of ‘ribs’.

Transportation ($15,000): It will take 6 flatbed trucks to take the Temple – plus all of the tools and equipment we need – the 323 miles from Alameda, CA to Black Rock City, NV. 

Insurance ($5,000): Gotta have it!

Build spaces ($16,000): The rent we pay for our Alameda space and our American Steel space in Oakland.

Burn supplies ($6,000):  For burn related needs; includes additional firewood, burlap, fuel, and paraffin wax.

Leave No Trace tools ($11,000): Decomposed granite and LNT tools; ​required to protect the playa from the burn and to ensure we leave no trace afterward.

Grove Trees ($45,000): The cost to fabricate the three metal Trees that will be in the courtyard of the Temple of Promise.

On-playa power and lighting ($17,000): For build-related power and lights; ​use of power tools, lighting, etc. during the two weeks of building on the playa as well as a generator and fuel for our underground power grid to keep the Temple lit throughout the event.

Build camp ($13,000): Our 130 volunteer builders will be arriving to construct the Temple on playa 2 weeks before the gates of Burning Man officially open. For them, building the Temple is a labor of love, but they cannot do it without your support. Power, lights, fuel, food, water, shelter, safety equipment, insurance, shade, and more. They will be giving their all, we need to make sure they can do so safely.

Stretch Goal: Copper ($30,000): The shimmering copper cowl featured on the immense skyward-reaching spire of the Temple will inspire awe in all those who will enter.

Total Cost:  $280,000

To date, we have raised $240,000 .  We are asking our community to help us raise $20,000 to $50,000 with this campaign.  

The Temple of Promise belongs to everyone – not only to those most able to give, not only to those who live in the Bay Area and have the time and ability to come build with us.  All of Burning Man is a communal effort.  Everyone who gives what they can in whatever way they can is part of the Temple crew. Now is the time where your gift will benefit every burner who visits and connects with the Temple.

Please join us now in building this temple together. 

With gratitude,

The Dreamers Guild


Share Your Stories 

Over the course of this campaign we will be sharing stories about what the Temple means to the individuals in our community. We will start with videos of volunteers from the Temple crew, but we want to hear from you, too. Send us your videos and share the incredible memories you have of Temples past. We speak, the Temple listens.

stories@templeofpromise.org

Tax Deductible Donations

The Temple of Promise and its volunteers do not earn profit from any donations. While we are not able to register as a non-profit, we have partnered with registered 501(c)3 organizations to enable you to make tax deductible donations. If you are interested in making such a donation please contact us at patron@templeofpromise.org or visit our website at http://www.templeofpromise.org/

Our Perks

Sticker with Temple of Promise insignia

T-shirt with Temple of Promise insignia

Temple of Promise pendant

Temple of Promise medallion (no wood inlay pictured)

story:
Migration Matters Festival

'A big welcome to our Refugee Week arts festival'

Hi all, my name is Sam Holland, a theatre-maker from Sheffield and I'm coordinating Migration Matters Festival, a Pay What You Decide arts and theatre festival at Theatre Delicatessen during Refugee Week, 17-25th June 2016.

Working alongside me is Sarah Sharp from Theatre Delicatessen, a producer who supports emerging artists by providing spaces for creative projects, ideas and experimentation.

This will be the second year we organise an arts festival for Refugee Week after Refuge Festival, 2015 (see pictures below).

Within the vast interior of an Old Woolworths, our programme will feature arts performances and activities that comment on or celebrate the UK as a sanctuary for refugees, asylum seekers and other victims of forced migration, and recognising the enormous contribution they have brought to this country, as well as raising awareness of the issues that surround the current refugee crisis.

We have invited established companies, emerging artists, community arts groups & charitable organisations to be part of a rich and soulful programme that brings the diverse and global mix of Sheffield's communities together in a celebration of food, culture and performance.

In order for us to build this exciting programme and allow all of it's communities to engage however we need as much help and support for the project as possible.

    

   The Northern Refugee Centre          The play 'Sanctum' from                                     Fashion Show                                               Quite Right Theatre



What We Need:
What your contribution will go towards:

£1000 - Artists Fund:

Helping to enhance our programme by giving a platform to emerging artists, community groups and activity leaders from across the city and beyond, supporting their travel, sustenance and work.

£500 - Marketing the festival:

We need to tell Sheffield and the world about the amazing events that are happening.  We don't want any person from any community in the city to be left out of our celebration. We will be using the money to print flyers, posters, brochures and more that tell the people of Sheffield about what we are offering and where to find it.

£500 - Free teas and coffees for visitors:

There are many people (those from the city and those who have newly arrived) in Sheffield who are financially vulnerable, and who we would like to welcome into the space to enjoy a hot beverage and enjoy some free art in the process.

£300 - Materials for our citizens 'Welcome' cafe:

What's the point in having a celebration without a colourful and vibrant place to host it? Our festival designer will require materials to help create a dazzling space for conversation, storytelling and creativity with a refurbished cafe to bring people together.


Perks:
£5 - Social Media Shout out 

£10 - A journey lantern made during the festival 

£15 - Postcard and thank you from the festival team

£25 - A special mention on our partners page on our website 

£50 - A bottle of fizz with the festival team

£75 - Top Throne, 2 prime seats at any performance during the week

£100 - The Full Monty 


The Impact
Sheffield was the UK's first City of Sanctuary and many people have forgotten that fact.  It doesn't help that the media insist on describing the thousands of people fleeing warzones as 'swarms', 'criminals', 'terrorists'.

Migration Matters Festival, throughout the week intends to counter the fear-mongering and reaffirm our city's status as a place where the people who have sought sanctuary in the city ought to be recognised not as refugees and asylum seekers but people of our city, Sheffielders, who have made it richer for being a part of it.

Partnering with the city's refugee charities and action groups, we will aim to create an arts sanctuary which in bringing the people of Sheffield together can leave a legacy of cultural unity beyond the week itself.

With this years Refugee Week theme of 'Welcome' we want to do just that and invite as many Sheffielder's through the doors as possible, whether you're from Totley or Gleadless, Kabul or Damascus.


      
Open Kitchen Social Club serve           Vertebra Arts' 'Wire Men' exhibit                  food from around the world 


Previous Experience: Refuge Festival

During Refugee Week last year, with little resources & no funding we put together an arts programme that was smaller but just as bracing & dynamic. 


           

Refuge Festival Poster Image                     Refuge Festival Programme (2015)



We proudly welcomed hundreds of people through the doors of the Deli to enjoy music, theatre, fashion, film, debates, food & more.

This year however we to amplify those elements and build on the foundations of last years success by bringing in more people to enjoy a wider and more diverse programme.


Risks & Challenges

There's no doubt organising a festival of this scale will have it's hurdles, whether it's securing high profile companies and artists, transforming a formerly abandoned Woolworths into a hospitable haven or getting word out to all of Sheffield's far reaching postcodes.

However, who better to combat and relish those challenges than  a meticulously organised production team, who between them posses a wealth of experience & who are all ardently committed to the project and the causes it supports.

The festival is also supported by Sheffield Theatres who have provided artist support, the charities; City of Sanctuary, Arts on the Run, Assist, Refugee Council & SYMAAG, all of whom the team meets regularly and who have been an enormous help in informing their service users, their members and the general public.

       
Migrant Question Time Panel Event            Amorf with Persian Folk 


If you are unable to donate our cause;

We absolutely understand and admire that there are so many worthwhile causes out there that people support and are fully aware that one more can be one too many.

Therefore we ask that you support us in other ways - Use the power of your voice to spread news of Migration Matters Festival to your friends and family and let them know about all that we have going on.

Come along! As I mentioned, the festival is Pay What You Decide so you can contribute whatever is within your means and with an incredible programme of shows you're not going to want to miss out on this.


Check us out on:


Twitter - MigMatFest
Facebook - Migration Matters Festival
Website - www.migrationmattersfestival.co.uk

story:
Our Story

"Cafe Verde"    My dream...inspired by the idea of community, Cafe Verde is a symbol of growth... a unique temporary structure that  will cultivate ideas, education and community.  A 60' tall towering structure in the shape of a giant beanstalk.  On the 6th floor 48'  feet in the sky will be an observation deck to look down on the city in which it grows. On the interior, the 1st and main floor will have a cafe that serves free homemade soups and teas, we will have a stage to conduct sustainable living and alternative energy seminars, spoken word, poetry, live acoustic music and  children's storytelling.  Its conception will be at the Black Rock City Art event titled "Burning Man" buts its potential is endless.  Once its been created initially it has the ability to be rebuilt anywhere. My ultimate goal is to reach all communities and Cafe Verde will represent a place of growth. With the help of sponsors we will have the ability to educate and inspire children, conduct food drives and clothing drives for the needy. The possibilities are endless once its first grown.


The Impact

Projected impact is to initiate community involvement around the world, centered around the idea of exchange in the fields of art, education and community. 


What We Need & What You Get


Our goal is $33,800.. I have used sophisticated budgeting software to estimate each penny! If I do not reach at least half the goal than I will personally refund your money.  Half the amount will allow me to create the structure, the full goal will allow me to create the structure, cafe, seating, stage, sound system and storage of this Giant Structure.. Lets aim for the full goal!

DONATION  AND REWARD:

$10-$35.00  Special Thank you Card and surprise seed to harvest yourself


$35.00  or more gets you a Special Thank you Card,  Surprise seeds to harvest yourself and reap the benefits, Original handmade silk screen shirt Mens or Womens T-shirt with original Bean Stalk Graphic


$500.00 or more Special thank you Card, Surprise seeds to Harvest yourself and reap the benefits,  Original handmade silk screen shirt Mens or Womens T-shirt with original Bean Stalk Graphic, DIY Projects Book, A custom one of a kind Childrens story Book about this giant stalk and the magic it creates... made by a young inspiring children's storyteller,  a making of dvd with your name listed in the producer credits


$1000.00  Special thank you Card, Surprise seeds to Harvest yourself and reap the benefits,  Original handmade silk screen shirt Mens or Womens T-shirt with original Bean Stalk Graphic, DIY Projects Book, A custom one of a kind Childrens story Book about this giant stalk and the magic it creates... made personally myself a making of dvd with your name listed in the producer credits, Renewable resources book 


$5000,00  Special Thank you card, Surprise seeds to harvest yourself and reap the benefits,  1 handmade silk screen shirt with a beanstalk print +  a making of dvd + a dinner on me t to any restaurant you want + a ticket to the event + SLEEP IN BEANSTALK...  a BEDROOM IN THE BEANSTALK.. VIEW OF OUR CITY FROM 20'  IN THE AIR.  AMAZING SUN RISE AND SUNSET =)  LIMITED AVAILABILITY


Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE SPREAD THE LINK TO EVERYONE YOU KNOW!

story:
L'histoire/My Story

Je m'appelle Antoine Bertin et je suis un artiste spécialisé dans le sonore. Je m'intéresse en particulier aux distances (spatiales, temporelles) qui séparent les lieux et invente des moyens pour les (re)connecter, physiquement et émotionnellement. Né à Paris en 1985, j'habite Londres depuis 2009, où je travaille en tant qu'ingénieur dans le cadre de projets artistiques, sonores et musicaux.


Antoine Bertin - Invisible Soundscapes I -  2009
---------------------

My name is Antoine Bertin and I am an artist specialising in sound. Born in 1985 in Paris, I have lived and worked in London for the last three years as an artist and sound engineer. My art practice is driven by nostalgia and consists of soundwalks, radio pieces, performances and installation work. I am interested in the spatial and temporal distances between places, and in finding ways of (re)connecting these spaces through sound, physically and emotionally.


Le projet/The project


'Des Sons du Ciel de Paris' est une installation pour microphone, ballon d'helium et système de communication sans fil. Dans un lieu dégagé, le microphone est attaché à un ballon météorologique qui s’élance dans le ciel parisien. Au sol, des écouteurs sont mis à disposition de la foule qui s’immerge dans les sons de Paris, entendus du ciel, et contemple la vue sur la ville. Inspirée par l’idée d’ 'excursion psychique', cette installation à pour but d’offrir au public une vue sonore, flottante et légère, sur la ville de Paris.

Sélectionné pour la Nuit Blanche 2011, j'ai l'opportunité de pouvoir réaliser ce projet dans un magnifique jardin, situé au sommet de la butte Montmartre.


Ecoutez un extrait du son du parc de la Turlure.


La mairie de Paris met à ma disposition le parc de la Turlure, se charge de la promotion du projet et veillera à la sécurité du lieu le soir de l'évènement. 

J'ai déjà réuni trois sponsors qui, par biais de prêt de matériel (ballon, microphone, etc.), me permettent de fabriquer le gros de l'installation.

Il me reste à réunir $1400 (environ 1000€) pour compléter ce système et le transformer en une oeuvre d'art retentissante! Grâce à Indigogo et Paypal, je peux accéder à l'argent immédiatement afin de commencer la construction de l'installation dès maintenant.


Parc de la Turlure - Jour

Représentation 3D de l'installation

---------------------


'Des Sons du Ciel de Paris' is an installation for wireless microphone and helium balloon. Listening to the sounds captured by a microphone hovering above the city, the audience is taken on an 'out of body' journey into the atmosphere of the capital.

My project has just been selected to be part of the 'Nuit Blanche 2011', a contemporary arts festival happening once a year in Paris. Artists from all over the world are invited to create work for one night in the streets, gardens, museums, schools, churches of the city.

'Nuit Blanche' is giving me the opportunity to realize 'Des Sons du Ciel de Paris' in a magnificent garden located in Montmartre, right down by the Sacré-Coeur. The festival is taking care of the promotion of the artwork as well as of the security during the event.


listen to the sound of the parc at night here.


I have found three sponsors who have generously offered to lend me most of the equipment I need to construct the installation.

I now need to find $1400 (about £900) in order to gather the last ingredients I need to transform my sketches into a artwork in its own right ! Using Indigogo and paypal, I can access the money immediatly and start constructing the piece.



Parc de la Turlure - Night


3D representation of the installation

L'impact/ The Impact

Ce travail fait suite à trois années de travail artistique sur le thème de l'écoute d'espaces distants et inaccessibles. Au cours de ces recherches j'ai pu rencontrer et échanger mes idées avec de nombreux artistes, chercheurs et ingénieurs, en Angleterre comme en France. 'Des Sons du Ciel de Paris' est le premier projet d'envergure que j'organiserai dans ma ville d'origine et l'occasion de soumettre mon travail à un large public, ainsi que de me mesurer aux artistes établis. A travers la perspective sonore que je proposerai de la ville, je souhaite enrichir et encourager le dialogue entre les scènes françaises et anglaises de l'art et de la recherche sonore.


---------------------


'Des Sons du Ciel de Paris' was inspired by three years of artistic experimentations focusing on the listening of places located 'just outside of our reach'. During this time, I have met many artists, researchers and engineers with whom I had the chance to discuss my ideas and realizations. 'Des Sons du Ciel de Paris' is the first project I will realize in Paris after having moved to London three years ago. It is an opportunity for me to propose a sonic perspective on the city I originate from and to show my work to a large audience of artists, curators, art critics and members of the public. Through this project, I hope to enrich and stimulate the dialogue between the British and the French Sound Art scenes.


Ce dont le projet a besoin et ce que vous recevrez en échange/ What I need and what you get.

'Des Sons du Ciel de Paris' est soutenu par Tapages, Creatmosphere et StudioTime qui fournissent respectivement:

-l'essentiel de l'équipement sonore (microphone, transmission sans fil, distributeur de casque),

-un gros ballon éclairé de l'intérieur

-la documentation visuelle du projet

J'ai besoin de votre soutien pour construire la structure d'arrimage du ballon, acheter des écouteurs et les adapter à la structure afin d'acheminer les sons du microphone jusqu'aux oreilles des visiteurs, acheter suffisamment d'helium, imprimer un livret qui accompagnera la visite de l'oeuvre, élaborer le décor (costume d''explorateur sonore', petits ballons, etc..)

Vous trouverez ci-dessous le décompte des éléments correspondant aux $1400: l'objectif à atteindre pour povoir  réaliser 'Des Sons du Ciel de Paris'.

J'ai prévu différentes contreparties en échange de votre participation comme une série limité d'images imprimées du projet, les enregistrements audio du microphone suspendu ou même une performance sur mesure! (voir 'perks', à droite de cette présentation où vous pouvez contribuer à l'oeuvre et voir ce qui vous sera envoyé en échange). Ces cadeaux de remerciements vous seront envoyés dès l'installation terminée.


- Accessoires: $100

- Helium: $150

- Impression du Livret: $250

- Pièces pour la construction de la structure d'arrimage (bois et métal): $400

- fabrication d'une trentaine de casques audio (composants éléctroniques, cables): $500


Si l'objectif des $1400 est dépassé, cela permettra tout simplement à l'oeuvre d'accueillir plus de visiteurs simultanément. (plus de casques et plus de livrets)


---------------------


'Des Sons du Ciel de Paris' is supported by three companies: Tapages, Creatmosphere and StudioTime which will provide respectively:

-the main sound system (wireless microphone, headphone amplifier),

-a huge glowing weather balloon

-the visual documentation of the project.

I need your help to build the structure that will hold the main balloon, buy headphones and adapt them to the structure, buy helium in sufficient quantity, print a program note and design the set (e.g 'sound explorer costumes', small balloons).

Here is the breakdown of the $1400 which I need to gather to be able to realize 'Des Sons du Ciel de Paris'. To thank you for your donations, I offer a series of perks such as limited edition prints of the artwork, audio recordings from the sky of Paris and even a tailor-made 'balloon performance' !


- Accessories: $100

- Helium: $150

- Printing of the program note: $250

- Structure on which the balloon will be attached (wood and metal): $400

- Fabrication of 30 headphones (electronics): $500


Autres manières dont vous pouvez participer/Other ways you can help

Il y a d'autres moyens que de faire une donation pour aider 'Des Sons du Ciel de Paris' à se construire:


-En faisant passer le mot et invitant vos connaissances à consulter cette page et la page facebook du projet

-En rejoignant l'équipe de bénévoles qui, vétus de costumes d'explorateurs, assureront l'accueil et le bon fonctionnement de l'oeuvre. Ecrire à contact@antoinebertin.com.
-En vous rendant avec vos amis au parc de la Turlure dans la nuit du 1ier au 2 octobre pour écouter le ciel de Paris!

Pour plus de détails sur mon travail: www.antoinebertin.com and http://soundoesntravel.org/



Thank you !
---------------------

There are other ways you can help me with the project:

-By telling your friends, family and business partners about 'Des Sons du Ciel de Paris', this indigogo page and the facebook page of the project
-By joining the team of volunteers that will help running the installation. write to contact@antoinebertin.com.
-By coming down to Paris on the 1st of October to listen the sounds of the Paris sky !

For more details about my work: www.antoinebertin.com and http://soundoesntravel.org/




Merci !

story:
Why this?

My name is Kim Pickens and I am an artist, mother, activist and curator.  I believe there are many stories that need to be told and when you can help that process, you should shout that story from the mountaintop.
 
Social justice movements cover a lot of ground, but poverty affects us all in some way, shape and form.  In 2008, I attended the opening of Understanding Poverty at Houston's Diverse Works gallery.  This photo exhibit chronicled 20 years of the lives of real people living in various states of poverty by photojournalist, Ben Tecumseh DeSoto.
 
When I moved from Houston to Victoria several months ago, I became involved with the Victoria Area Homeless Coalition and one of their biggest challenges is community awareness.  The opportunity to have this exhibit travel here to hang at Victoria's only gallery museum presented itself and I contacted Ben.

What can YOU do?

Ben DeSoto has always dreamed of "Understanding Poverty" traveling to different cities, but hasn't had the means to make this happen.  The photo exhibit has been stored since its initial show at a private home and at SEARCH in downtown Houston.  Some of the works have been damaged and others need to be reframed.  The majority of photos are in working condition and ready to hang at the Nave here in Victoria.  In order to travel, they need to have containers and packing material to keep them safe and the works that have been damaged need to be repaired.


Funds are needed for:

  • printing for publicity
  • frames
  • storage containers
  • archival supplies
  • travel expenses for the artist to attend opening

It is important to show the Victoria community that poverty is not just an urban situation but a human condition that can be changed based on our community action.

Your support in helping this project travel from Houston to Victoria and beyond is appreciated more than you know.  Every dollar helps to spread the word!


Peace & Blessings,

kim pickens

story:
WWW.FILLINGTHEWELL.ORG

TESTIMONIALS

FACEBOOK ME


ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX-DEDUCTIBLE!

WITH YOUR HELP

The next 3 Filling the Well Artist's Retreat in 2012 are already booked up, and we have already scheduled the next 3 Artists-in-Residence. We can't do this without the space. And your donations go to paying for exactly that.


What is Filling the Well?
An interview with Diana Oh
Questions curated by, Christine Drew Benjamin



Q: How did you come up with the idea behind Filling the Well?
A:                
...I came up with the idea of  "Filling the Well" because of something I came across when I was in Grad school at NYU. It was the summer before my thesis year and I was battling an extreme amount of performance anxiety. I felt like people were expecting me to succeed and write the most amazing brilliant earth-shattering piece of theatre ever written. I spent week after week trying to create one hell of a musical and putting myself under the most unrealistic expectations. I cracked one day because I simply couldn't handle the pressure. I felt like I failed and experienced my very first panic attack. That's when I knew something was up--that's when I knew I wasn't okay. I sought counseling because it was free to all NYU Tisch students and my counselor told me A) You're depressed and B) Maybe you just need to fill your well. Go see a movie. And she was absolutely right: my well was empty. I had nothing to create from, no inspiration to pull from, no story to tell. How could I create if I was creating from a place of end-picture ideologies. That thinking is never going to merit good work--well, I shouldn't say never but it certainly wasn't working for me. The Filling the Well Artist's Retreat feels like the perfect synthesis of who I am and the experiences I want to share with others. It's a place I want artists to come to make things the way I like to make things. A place where you are given absolute permission. And a place where you fill your well by getting away from the city, surrounding yourself with other artists, exposing yourself to new territories and opening yourself up to whatever comes your way.


Q: Can you tell me about a little bit about the background of the home you are taking the artists to?
A:                       
...The home we are going to is my Aunt Cece and Godmother Mary's home. Aunt Cece passed away this past February and Mary passed 10 years ago. As a family, we are still healing and mourning the loss of two unbelievable human beings. They ran an adoption agency together and lived with one another in this home for almost thirty years. It's housed many animals. It's full of loving energy, mystery, and their spirit and it was heartbreaking to have this house sitting on 2.5 acres of land, in the middle of historic Doylestown, only 2 and 1/2 hours from the city stay empty, cold, and unlived in. It was screaming "use me, make use of me." And I knew in my gut, in my heart, in every nerve ending in my being that I needed to do something about it. My family who all live on the Westcoast, where I'm originally from know I'm hosting the retreat and are in complete support of Filling the Well. Our wish is to build on the land. For  example, we'd like build a black box theatre to help establish the retreat as a regular artist haven. It's screaming potential. The house doesn't have any doors, it's all open--all the bedrooms, like an orphanage. Exactly as I want the artists to be--you don't need much, just a great group of people and enthusiasm and suddenly there's genius at your fingertips. There is a garage with an office next door, an empty sun room, kitchen, dining area, gazebo. My boyfriend and I went to clean the place up a few weeks ago to make space for all the artists. I'm excited to see what the house feels like once bodies are in it. It will always be Cece and Mary's home though and I know people will be respectful of that. It's a special place and you can't help but feel their warmth wrapped up all around you when you're there. The home feels like a gift. A gift that cannot go to waste. Oh, and there's a lake.

TO READ MORE VISIT:
WWW.FILLINGTHEWELL.ORG
story_txt:
WWW.FILLINGTHEWELL.ORG

TESTIMONIALSFACEBOOK ME

ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX-DEDUCTIBLE!


WITH YOUR HELP


The next 3 Filling the Well Artist's Retreat in 2012 are already booked up, and we have already scheduled the next 3 Artists-in-Residence. We can't do this without the space. And your donations go to paying for exactly that.


What is Filling the Well?An interview with Diana OhQuestions curated by, Christine Drew Benjamin


Q: How did you come up with the idea behind Filling the Well?A:                ...I came up with the idea of  "Filling the Well" because of something I came across when I was in Grad school at NYU. It was the summer before my thesis year and I was battling an extreme amount of performance anxiety. I felt like people were expecting me to succeed and write the most amazing brilliant earth-shattering piece of theatre ever written. I spent week after week trying to create one hell of a musical and putting myself under the most unrealistic expectations. I cracked one day because I simply couldn't handle the pressure. I felt like I failed and experienced my very first panic attack. That's when I knew something was up--that's when I knew I wasn't okay. I sought counseling because it was free to all NYU Tisch students and my counselor told me A) You're depressed and B) Maybe you just need to fill your well. Go see a movie. And she was absolutely right: my well was empty. I had nothing to create from, no inspiration to pull from, no story to tell. How could I create if I was creating from a place of end-picture ideologies. That thinking is never going to merit good work--well, I shouldn't say never but it certainly wasn't working for me. The Filling the Well Artist's Retreat feels like the perfect synthesis of who I am and the experiences I want to share with others. It's a place I want artists to come to make things the way I like to make things. A place where you are given absolute permission. And a place where you fill your well by getting away from the city, surrounding yourself with other artists, exposing yourself to new territories and opening yourself up to whatever comes your way.Q: Can you tell me about a little bit about the background of the home you are taking the artists to?A:                       ...The home we are going to is my Aunt Cece and Godmother Mary's home. Aunt Cece passed away this past February and Mary passed 10 years ago. As a family, we are still healing and mourning the loss of two unbelievable human beings. They ran an adoption agency together and lived with one another in this home for almost thirty years. It's housed many animals. It's full of loving energy, mystery, and their spirit and it was heartbreaking to have this house sitting on 2.5 acres of land, in the middle of historic Doylestown, only 2 and 1/2 hours from the city stay empty, cold, and unlived in. It was screaming "use me, make use of me." And I knew in my gut, in my heart, in every nerve ending in my being that I needed to do something about it. My family who all live on the Westcoast, where I'm originally from know I'm hosting the retreat and are in complete support of Filling the Well. Our wish is to build on the land. For  example, we'd like build a black box theatre to help establish the retreat as a regular artist haven. It's screaming potential. The house doesn't have any doors, it's all open--all the bedrooms, like an orphanage. Exactly as I want the artists to be--you don't need much, just a great group of people and enthusiasm and suddenly there's genius at your fingertips. There is a garage with an office next door, an empty sun room, kitchen, dining area, gazebo. My boyfriend and I went to clean the place up a few weeks ago to make space for all the artists. I'm excited to see what the house feels like once bodies are in it. It will always be Cece and Mary's home though and I know people will be respectful of that. It's a special place and you can't help but feel their warmth wrapped up all around you when you're there. The home feels like a gift. A gift that cannot go to waste. Oh, and there's a lake.TO READ MORE VISIT: WWW.FILLINGTHEWELL.ORG

story:
Hello friends,

As you know Case2 (Jeffrey Brown) passed away on Sunday. Being that he and his family were not wealthy they need our help in paying for his funeral and burial. Any help would be appreciated.

Funeral arrangements have been booked for this Thursday at R.G Ortiz funeral home. 524 southern boulevard, bronx New York. Tele:718-585-5700. Viewing is  Thursday from 2:00pm- 9:00pm with service from 6pm-7pm. Then the burial will on friday 9:30 am departure for the Forest Green cementary in Morganville, New Jersey.


The cost of the funeral and burial is $7000. We are looking to raise $5600 as we have raised $1400 from Henry Chalfant, Part One, and myself.


Your money will be used to pay for the wake, the funeral costs, and the burial. 

No amount of help is too small. All help is appreciated. 


CASE was a tremendous artist and friend. Please help.
