story:
Who Am I?

My name is Siyi Qian, and I come from Beijing, China. I am majoring in Business Design and Arts Leadership at Savannah College of Arts and Design (SCAD). To fulfill my final project in the M.A. Business Design and Arts Leadership graduate program, I am curating a visual art exhibition titled The Creative Mixture of Art in Savannah, Georgia.

 

About The Exhibition

The Creative Mixture of Art is a visual arts exhibition that will be open from August 4 to August 6, 2017 at the Sulfur Studios at 2301 Bull St. in Savannah, Georgia. The opening reception will be held on August 4 from 5 pm to 9 pm, which is the first Friday monthly Art March day in Savannah. It is free to the public with foods and drinks.

This exhibition will provide a platform for young artists to exhibit their mixed arts and express their creative ideas. This exhibition will showcase 30 artworks from two SCAD Graduate students, Hanting Zhang and Siqiao Liu, who are majoring in Painting. Hanting Zhang’s pop mixture portraits combine the western and eastern cultures to use superheroes as subject to uphold justice. Siqiao Liu’s mixed media paintings combine different cultures and art forms to show femininity through charming, confident, and beautiful women bodies. They combine the different art forms and the different cultures to present an excellent mixture of contemporary art and traditional art.

 

What do We need?

This online crowdfunding campaign through Indiegogo will help me raise $1100 in five weeks from July 6 to August 6 in order to hold a successful exhibition.

This online crowdfunding campaign will cover the budget as follows:

$500 for three days’ gallery rental fee

$110 for 40 posters’ printing

$150 for 400 postcards’ printing

$100 for 100 exhibition catalogs’ printing

$150 for food and beverages

$20 for artworks’ label

$70 for other expenses

 

Perks!

$10: For a $10 contribution, you will receive a Thank-you letter via email.

$25: For a $25 contribution, you will receive a Thank-you letter with a high definition image of exhibition via email.

$50: For a $50 contribution, you will receive a Thank-you letter, a postcard, and two high-definition images of the exhibition.

$100: For a $100 contribution, you will receive a hand-written thank-you letter, a postcard, and four high-definition images of the exhibition.

$150: For a $150 contribution, you will receive a hand-written thank-you letter, a postcard, six high-definition images of the exhibition, and a private exhibition tour.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share The Creative Mixture of Art Indiegogo page with your friends.
  • Join The Creative Mixture of Art Facebook Event Page to find more information and share this event page with your Facebook friends. www.facebook.com/events/168338413707137
  • Follow The Creative Mixture of Art Instagram account for update information.​thecreativemixture_0804          https://www.instagram.com/thecreativemixture_0804/

Thank you very much for your time and your support. If you have any questions, please contact me at siyiqian20@gmail.com.

story:
Gender Unbound Art Fest is a multi-discipline art festival that exclusively features transgender and intersex creators. The festival celebrates the art, music, and performance of an often marginalized community, empowers gender-diverse creators, and educates the general public in a context outside of celebrity coming-out stories or bathroom legislation.The event also connects attendees to much-needed services and organizations.

If you are a trans or intersex artist, musician, performer, or filmmaker and would like to participate in the festival, please submit to be considered on our website through April 28th.

The 4th annual Gender Unbound Art Fest will take place in Austin, TX on Sept 21-22, 2019 (plus weeknight showcases, dates TBA). We need your help to make Gender Unbound 2019 a success!

What We Need

Gender Unbound is a nonprofit project that uplifts, supports, and advocates for transgender and intersex communities through arts and programming created by transgender and intersex people. Gender Unbound is funded in part by a grant by the City of Austin Cultural Arts Division of Economic Development, which requires a us to match a certain percentage of the grant amount. In order to receive a $20,050 grant from the city, we need to fundraise a match amount of $8,150.

On average, Gender Unbound Art Fest costs about $35,000 to put on. In addition to fundraising through Indiegogo, we raise revenue through badge sales, advertisements, sponsorships, merchandise sales, and private donations.

The City of Austin grant will help pay for venue rental, some of our marketing, event staffing, and some of the stipends and travel expenses paid to artists, musicians, and performers. Other elements of the event, like beverages and signage, are sourced through in-kind donations of goods. We need your help to pay for other expenses, including our grant-required match amount of $8,150.

Our $7,500 funding goal (minus Indiegogo fees of 5%-10%) will pay for:

  • The remainder of the venue rental fee.
  • Event insurance (required by both city and venue contracts).
  • U-Haul rental for load-in and load-out.
  • Equipment rentals, including tables, chairs, lighting, audiovisual equipment, and assistive listening devices.
  • Artist stipends. Many art shows charge application and exhibition fees, but Gender Unbound Art Fest offers a stipend to every featured musician, performer, visual artist, and filmmaker.
  • Travel stipends for out-of-state artists to assist with transportation and lodging costs.
  • Printing of materials including tickets, badges, surveys, stickers, posters, and signage.
  • Event supplies including kraft paper rolls, tape, art hanging supplies, extension cords, 
  • Contractor stipends paid to the photographer, videographer, sound tech, graphic designer, and other key skilled contractors.
  • Administrative stipends paid to the stage manager, volunteer coordinator, and other key event organizers.

If we meet our $7,500 goal, any additional funds will help us:

  • Increase the stipend amounts for all artists, musicians, performers, filmmakers, contractors, and event organizers.
  • Increase the number and amount of travel stipends available for out-of-state artists.
  • Bring headliner act--nationally-known musicians and performers--to the event.
  • Increase the total number of creators featured at the festival.
  • Fund future events, including future Gender Unbound Art Fests and smaller-scale year-round events like Transgender Day of Visibility, Intersex Awareness Day, and the Gender Unbound Winter Art Market.

Gender Unbound is a nonprofit project. All money stays within the organization to fulfill our mission. Any funds raised beyond the $7,500 goal will help the festival grow sustainably.

Perks

To ensure the maximum amount of funding goes towards the festival itself, we have minimized the amount of Indiegogo money that will be used to fulfill perk rewards. Our substantial Indiegogo perks offer high-value items that are already being created for the festival, like festival tickets, shirts, and art.

All perks will be delivered digitally or picked up in-person at the festival. This ensures that no Indiegogo funds are used for shipping or handling of perks. If you want to support Gender Unbound but can't make it to Austin for the festival, please consider perks like sponsored tickets or projected ads.

$10: One-Day Pass

Get one advance day pass (Saturday or Sunday) to Gender Unbound 2019 at 33% off the full ticket price of $15.

$20: Day Passes for Two

Make it a date night or bring a friend! Get two day passes to Gender Unbound 2019, plus two Gender Unbound stickers to remember your awesome night together. That is a $36 value!

$25: Full Festival Badge

Get one full festival badge to the entire 2019 Gender Unbound Art Fest! A full festival badge grants access to Saturday, Sunday, and all Weeknight Showcases (final dates TBA). Enjoy our entire lineup of visual art, music, performance, film, and more at a pre-sale discount!

$25: Sponsor a Full Festival Badge

Sponsor one full festival badge so that a trans/intersex community member can attend Gender Unbound Art Fest for free!

Sponsored badges are distributed to organizations that serve trans, intersex, and LGBTQIA people in Texas to be distributed to their constituents. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to experience financial hardship. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to marginalized communities.

$40: Shirt Package for One

Wear your support for trans and intersex artists on your sleeve with one Gender Unbound shirt! You'll also receive one full festival badge and two Gender Unbound stickers. A $61 value!

Our upcycled shirts are environmentally friendly, hand screenprinted by local trans artists, and available in a wide range of styles, sizes, and colors. Shirts will be picked up in-person at the festival.

$40: Full Festival Badges for Two

Get two full festival badges to the entire 2019 Gender Unbound Art Fest! A full festival badge grants access to Saturday, Sunday, and all Weeknight Showcases (final dates TBA). Enjoy every day of the festival with your favorite companion and leave with a weekend of memories to share between you. Plus, receive four Gender Unbound stickers!

$50: Buy a Festival Badge + Sponsor a Badge

Treat yourself while giving back to the community. Get your one full festival badge for you, sponsor one full festival badge for a trans/intersex community member, and get two Gender Unbound stickers for you too!

Sponsored badges are distributed to organizations that serve trans, intersex, and LGBTQIA people in Texas to be distributed to their constituents. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to experience financial hardship. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to marginalized communities.

$80: Shirt Package for Two

Impress your plus-one with Gender Unbound shirts for two! Remember the good times you shared at Gender Unbound Art Fest and look great while doing it. For $80 you get two full festival badges, two Gender Unbound shirts, and four Gender Unbound stickers!

Our upcycled shirts are environmentally friendly, hand screenprinted by local trans artists, and available in a wide range of styles, sizes, and colors. Shirts will be picked up in-person at the festival.

$85: Quarter-Page Ad in the Gender Unbound Program

Boost your message! Get one quarter-page ad in the 2019 Gender Unbound Art Fest program* for yourself or your organization. Your ad will be seen and appreciated by hundreds of attendees throughout the festival every time they page through the program to find maps, schedules, artist information, trans & intersex 101, and more.

* All ads are subject to approval by festival organizers.

$100: Sponsor Four Badges

Give more the community! Sponsor four full festival badges for trans/intersex community members.

Sponsored badges are distributed to organizations that serve trans, intersex, and LGBTQIA people in Texas to be distributed to their constituents. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to experience financial hardship. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to marginalized communities.

$125: Art Bundle (only 5 offered)

Bring the festival home with you! Get an impressive bundle of art from 2019 exhibiting artists of Gender Unbound Art Fest. In addition to your new art collection, you'll get one full festival badge, two Gender Unbound Stickers, and one Gender Unbound Shirt.

Our upcycled shirts are environmentally friendly, hand screenprinted by local trans artists, and available in a wide range of styles, sizes, and colors. Shirts and art bundles will be picked up in-person at the festival.

$150: Sponsor Six Badges

Increase your community support! Sponsor six full festival badges for trans/intersex community members.

Sponsored badges are distributed to organizations that serve trans, intersex, and LGBTQIA people in Texas to be distributed to their constituents. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to experience financial hardship. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to marginalized communities.

$150: Half-Page Ad in the Gender Unbound Program

Stand out! Get one half-page ad in the 2019 Gender Unbound Art Fest program* for yourself or your organization! Your ad will be seen and appreciated by hundreds of attendees throughout the festival every time they page through the program to find maps, schedules, artist information, trans & intersex 101, and more.

* All ads are subject to approval by festival organizers.

$200: Vendor Table

Connect with trans and intersex communities! Get one six-foot vendor table* for two days (Saturday and Sunday) of the festival to spotlight your organization or business. We expect 450+ attendees during the 2019 festival weekend, and a vendor table offers a great opportunity to promote your products or services to hundreds of trans and intersex community members.

* Trans and intersex artists do not need to purchase a vendor table. Gender Unbound does not require artists to pay table fees or exhibition fees. Instead, please submit an application via our artist submission form through April 28 to be considered for participation.

$200: Sponsor Eight Badges

Be a champion for the community! Sponsor eight full festival badges for trans/intersex community members!

Sponsored badges are distributed to organizations that serve trans, intersex, and LGBTQIA people in Texas to be distributed to their constituents. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to experience financial hardship. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to marginalized communities.

$200: Full-Page Ad in the Gender Unbound Program

Get Noticed! Get one full-page ad in the 2019 Gender Unbound Art Fest program* for yourself or your organization! Your ad will be seen and appreciated by hundreds of attendees throughout the festival every time they page through the program to find maps, schedules, artist information, trans & intersex 101, and more.

* All ads are subject to approval by festival organizers.

$250: Sponsor Ten Badges

Be a community hero! Sponsor ten full festival badges for trans/intersex community members! Plus, get your name (or your business) listed on our website and in our program as a supporter of the festival.

Sponsored badges are distributed to organizations that serve trans, intersex, and LGBTQIA people in Texas to be distributed to their constituents. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to experience financial hardship. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to marginalized communities.

$500: Sponsor Twenty Badges

Be a community superstar! Sponsor twenty full festival badges for trans/intersex community members. Plus, get your name (or your business) listed on our website and in our program as a supporter of the festival.

Sponsored badges are distributed to organizations that serve trans, intersex, and LGBTQIA people in Texas to be distributed to their constituents. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to experience financial hardship. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to marginalized communities.

Sponsors:

Become a sponsor of the Gender Unbound Art Fest and help bring trans and intersex art to hundreds! Sponsors will be highlighted to all event attendees and online followers as supporters of trans and intersex creators and communities.

Each sponsor level offers different perks for you or your organization/business.

$500: Glitter Sponsor

  • One quarter-page ad in the festival program.
  • One social media shoutout in a Gender Unbound social media post.
  • Multiple on-stage shoutouts throughout the course of the festival.
  • Your name (or organization/business name) listed on the Gender Unbound website.
  • Your name (or organization/business name) listed on the sponsor page in the festival program.
  • Four full festival badges for Gender Unbound Art Fest 2019.

$1,000: Rainbow Sponsor

  • One half-page ad in the festival program.
  • Two social media shoutouts in Gender Unbound social media posts.
  • Multiple on-stage shoutouts throughout the course of the festival.
  • Your organization/business logo listed on the Gender Unbound website.
  • Your organization/business logo listed on the sponsor page in the festival program.
  • Six full festival badges for Gender Unbound Art Fest 2019.
  • One vendor table for the 2019 festival weekend.

$2,500: Butterfly Sponsor

  • You or your organization/business will be named as the sole sponsor of a Weeknight Showcase.
  • You or your organization/business can include a business card in all complimentary festival totes for attendees.
  • One full-page ad in the festival program.
  • One email blast shoutout mentioning you as a sponsor of the festival.
  • Mentioned as a sponsor in all online event pages (the festival Facebook event page, etc).
  • Three social media shoutouts in Gender Unbound social media posts.
  • Multiple on-stage shoutouts throughout the course of the festival.
  • Your organization/business logo listed on the Gender Unbound website.
  • Your organization/business logo listed on the sponsor page in the festival program.
  • One vendor table for the 2019 festival weekend.
  • Eight full festival badges for Gender Unbound Art Fest 2019.

$5,000: Unicorn Sponsor

  • You or your organization/business will be named as the sole sponsor of the festival gallery (listed on the gallery wall and in program materials).
  • You or your organization/business can include a business card, flyer, or small promotional item in all complimentary festival totes for attendees.
  • One full-page ad on the inside cover in the festival program.
  • One promotional banner displayed on a prominent wall during the festival.
  • One vendor table for the 2019 festival weekend.
  • One email blast shoutout mentioning you as a sponsor of the festival.
  • Mentioned as a sponsor in all online event pages (the festival Facebook event page, etc).
  • Three social media shoutouts in Gender Unbound social media posts.
  • Multiple on-stage shoutouts throughout the course of the festival.
  • Your organization/business logo listed on the Gender Unbound website.
  • Your organization/business logo listed on the sponsor page in the festival program.
  • Ten full festival badges for Gender Unbound Art Fest 2019.

$10,000: Phoenix Sponsor

  • You or your organization/business will be named as the sole sponsor of the festival main stage (listed on the stage wall and in program materials).
  • One full-page, outside back cover ad in the festival program.
  • Your logo displayed on the back of all full festival badges.
  • You or your organization/business can include a business card, flyer, or small promotional item in all complimentary festival totes for attendees.
  • Two promotional banners displayed on a prominent wall during the festival.
  • One vendor table for the 2019 festival weekend.
  • You or your organization/business mentioned as a sponsor in all promotional emails.
  • Mentioned as a sponsor in all online event pages (the festival Facebook event page, etc).
  • Three social media shoutouts in Gender Unbound social media posts.
  • Multiple on-stage shoutouts throughout the course of the festival.
  • Your organization/business logo listed on the Gender Unbound website.
  • Your organization/business logo listed on the sponsor page in the festival program.
  • Twelve full festival badges for Gender Unbound Art Fest 2019.

Contractor stipends paid to the photographer, videographer, sound tech, graphic designer, and other key skilled contractors.
Administrative stipends paid to the stage manager, volunteer coordinator, and other key event organizers.
If we meet our $7,500 goal, any additional funds will help us:
Increase the stipend amounts for all artists, musicians, performers, filmmakers, contractors, and event organizers.
Increase the number and amount of travel stipends available for out-of-state artists.
Bring headliner act--nationally-known musicians and performers--to the event.
Increase the total number of creators featured at the festival.
Fund future events, including future Gender Unbound Art Fests and smaller-scale year-round events like Transgender Day of Visibility, Intersex Awareness Day, and the Gender Unbound Winter Art Market.
Gender Unbound is a nonprofit project. All money stays within the organization to fulfill our mission. Any funds raised beyond the $7,500 goal will help the festival grow sustainably.PerksTo ensure the maximum amount of funding goes towards the festival itself, we have minimized the amount of Indiegogo money that will be used to fulfill perk rewards. Our substantial Indiegogo perks offer high-value items that are already being created for the festival, like festival tickets, shirts, and art.All perks will be delivered digitally or picked up in-person at the festival. This ensures that no Indiegogo funds are used for shipping or handling of perks. If you want to support Gender Unbound but can't make it to Austin for the festival, please consider perks like sponsored tickets or projected ads.$10: One-Day PassGet one advance day pass (Saturday or Sunday) to Gender Unbound 2019 at 33% off the full ticket price of $15.$20: Day Passes for TwoMake it a date night or bring a friend! Get two day passes to Gender Unbound 2019, plus two Gender Unbound stickers to remember your awesome night together. That is a $36 value!$25: Full Festival BadgeGet one full festival badge to the entire 2019 Gender Unbound Art Fest! A full festival badge grants access to Saturday, Sunday, and all Weeknight Showcases (final dates TBA). Enjoy our entire lineup of visual art, music, performance, film, and more at a pre-sale discount!$25: Sponsor a Full Festival BadgeSponsor one full festival badge so that a trans/intersex community member can attend Gender Unbound Art Fest for free!Sponsored badges are distributed to organizations that serve trans, intersex, and LGBTQIA people in Texas to be distributed to their constituents. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to experience financial hardship. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to marginalized communities.$40: Shirt Package for OneWear your support for trans and intersex artists on your sleeve with one Gender Unbound shirt! You'll also receive one full festival badge and two Gender Unbound stickers. A $61 value!Our upcycled shirts are environmentally friendly, hand screenprinted by local trans artists, and available in a wide range of styles, sizes, and colors. Shirts will be picked up in-person at the festival.$40: Full Festival Badges for TwoGet two full festival badges to the entire 2019 Gender Unbound Art Fest! A full festival badge grants access to Saturday, Sunday, and all Weeknight Showcases (final dates TBA). Enjoy every day of the festival with your favorite companion and leave with a weekend of memories to share between you. Plus, receive four Gender Unbound stickers!$50: Buy a Festival Badge + Sponsor a BadgeTreat yourself while giving back to the community. Get your one full festival badge for you, sponsor one full festival badge for a trans/intersex community member, and get two Gender Unbound stickers for you too!Sponsored badges are distributed to organizations that serve trans, intersex, and LGBTQIA people in Texas to be distributed to their constituents. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to experience financial hardship. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to marginalized communities.$80: Shirt Package for TwoImpress your plus-one with Gender Unbound shirts for two! Remember the good times you shared at Gender Unbound Art Fest and look great while doing it. For $80 you get two full festival badges, two Gender Unbound shirts, and four Gender Unbound stickers!Our upcycled shirts are environmentally friendly, hand screenprinted by local trans artists, and available in a wide range of styles, sizes, and colors. Shirts will be picked up in-person at the festival.$85: Quarter-Page Ad in the Gender Unbound ProgramBoost your message! Get one quarter-page ad in the 2019 Gender Unbound Art Fest program* for yourself or your organization. Your ad will be seen and appreciated by hundreds of attendees throughout the festival every time they page through the program to find maps, schedules, artist information, trans & intersex 101, and more.* All ads are subject to approval by festival organizers.$100: Sponsor Four BadgesGive more the community! Sponsor four full festival badges for trans/intersex community members.Sponsored badges are distributed to organizations that serve trans, intersex, and LGBTQIA people in Texas to be distributed to their constituents. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to experience financial hardship. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to marginalized communities.$125: Art Bundle (only 5 offered)Bring the festival home with you! Get an impressive bundle of art from 2019 exhibiting artists of Gender Unbound Art Fest. In addition to your new art collection, you'll get one full festival badge, two Gender Unbound Stickers, and one Gender Unbound Shirt.Our upcycled shirts are environmentally friendly, hand screenprinted by local trans artists, and available in a wide range of styles, sizes, and colors. Shirts and art bundles will be picked up in-person at the festival.$150: Sponsor Six BadgesIncrease your community support! Sponsor six full festival badges for trans/intersex community members.Sponsored badges are distributed to organizations that serve trans, intersex, and LGBTQIA people in Texas to be distributed to their constituents. Trans and intersex people (especially trans women of color) are statistically more likely to experience financial hardship. Sponsored badges help keep the festival accessible to marginalized communities.$150: Half-Page Ad in the Gender Unbound ProgramStand out! Get one half-page ad in the 2019 Gender Unbound Art Fest program* for yourself or your organization! Your ad will be seen and appreciated by hundreds of attendees throughout the festival every time they page through the program to find maps, schedules, artist information, trans & intersex 101, and more.* All ads are subject to approval by festival organizers.$200: Vendor TableConnect with trans and intersex communities! Get one six-foot vendor table* for two days (Saturday and Sunday) of the festival to spotlight your organization or business. We expect 450+ attendees during the 2019 festival weekend, and a vendor table offers a great opportunity to promote your products or services to hundreds of trans and intersex community members.* Trans and intersex artists do not need to purchase a vendor table. Gender Unbound does not require artists to pay table fees or exhibition fees. Instead, please submit an application via our artist submission form through April 28 to be considered for participation.$200: Sponsor Eight BadgesBe a champion for the community! story:
Short Summary

My name is Miles-DF, I draw furry erotica for almost 10 years now and I want to create more of printed stuff and you can help me to do that! Let me show you:

Artbook vol.1, Artbook vol.2, Artbook vol.3 (NEW) (18+ adults only)

It's my general stuff and I proud of this set of artworks because it is pretty and of a good quality. Glossy cover, nice paper inside, 50 finished arts, 50 linearts, 100 pages in each and every artbook. A4 format, pretty large, huh!


Pin-up Calendar 2016

Calendars is a new sort of stuff for me. Pretty large format calendar (A3) but mint-dog store has expierence in printing and sending this kind of stuff, so I do not worry if that's will be as cool as it was with Mint-dog's calendars. It's all SFW pictures inside... As safe as pin-up can be :)
So don't be afraid to put it on your wall. 12 month, 12 nice pin-up girls based on my busts pictures. Hope you like it.

Sketchbook vol.1 (18+ adults only) 

It's my new art collection that I want to start. I have many nice traditional sketches, so, why not gather them in this one small book? It is gonna be 50 sketches on 50 pages. Not large format A5 will look pretty adorable and I hope you'll like it too! 

What We Need & What You Get

Base goal  $3000 we can make a print minimum part in of all books.

More Goals:

$5000 FUNDED! - all who pledge $30+ get 10 Digital Wallpapers + 10 Hi-res files of my artworks including my 'Waterhole' and 'Workout' session pictures.

$8000 FUNDED! - all who pledged $30+ get 10x15 cm pinup magnet as a little gift, hope you'll like them!

$10000 FUNDED! - wow! Not sure if that will happen but I think I know how to surprise you :)


Risks & Challenges

We worked with contribution of awesome MintDog.ru press store and Vagabonda owner. I've been working with her store for one year and we already sold quite a few of my printed products, and we never had any displeased customers and we're working hard to achieve good quality and delivering everything in time. And I can trust Vagabonda with that project , it's a person who doesn't lose clients.


Other Ways You Can Help

I dont know how actualy, would be nice if you share it, maybe of some your friends want to contribute!

story:
Celebrating Women's History

Our aim is simple - include women in the public works of art in the town, in recognition of the significant contribution they have made, and continue to make, to the borough in politics, the arts, business, education, health, social care and science.

Despite a wealth of strong, high-achieving women in our history, Bedford numbers not one female statue amongst its 11 existing works of public art. This is a common theme across the country.

2018 marks 100 years since women won the right to vote, celebrated on a national level through the Vote 100 campaign. The timing is perfect for the first statue of one of Bedford's most inspiring women.

We have selected one of the town's most passionate advocates of women's equality -  a strong and enigmatic woman who was head of the local school, a business leader, educationalist, suffragette and politician. Amy Walmsley deserves a place amongst the celebrated leaders in the town's history. She will be sculpted by the renowned and experienced Diane Gorvin who has been working with communities for her whole career to bring to life their ambitions. This combination of women is determined to deliver this project for Bedford.

Who Are We?

'Women of Bedford' is a voluntary community group led by three professional women and involving the incredible women of Bedford.   We are working with the Mayor, the council, Bedford's museums including the Higgins, schools and community groups to celebrate the impact women have had on our heritage, and to inform and inspire current and future generations.

We are working across Bedford's community to ensure representation from the diverse population of the town, through education, art and engagement, with the aim of bringing these groups together. Through arts, events and partnership working, we extend our reach across multi-cultural groups, special needs organisations and specialist teams. 

Playing Your Part

By backing this campaign you will help to increase the visibility of women in our country's heritage - across art, in schools, in written and acknowledged history.

There is a growing recognition of a need to reflect strong women in our country's narrative, yet it remains that a mere 2.7% of the UK's statues are of historical, non-royal women. 

You can make a very real change - this project has already secured permission from the borough council and elected mayor to site the sculpture on The Embankment, a central position of prime importance in the town and a focus for foot and tourist traffic.

All that remains is to raise the funds for artist's fees, casting and installation of the sculpture, and a programme to involve local schools in participating in the creation of the finished piece, offering them a unique opportunity to be involved in a work of public art.

What We Need & What You Get

The entire project cost is £100,000.

We want to raise as much as possible through crowdfunding and corporate sponsorship. This is to place ownership in the hands of those who are passionate about reversing the historical trend of making women invisible.

PHASE 1 - We need £25,000 by the end of January to get the project off the ground. This covers the first instalment for the sculptor to begin her work.

In return, we offer several layers of involvement, depending on how much you want to give. We know that our project has inspired many people - we also know that not everyone can afford to make a big contribution. That's why we have made it easy for everyone to be involved. 

  • £20 At the start of the project we made a wild guess that, if every woman in the Borough contributed, we would hit the target needed to commission the sculpture. We want to try and make that happen. If you donate £20, you will be included in our Scroll of Supporters, displayed at the unveiling, to proudly show that the sculpture was achieved by the people.
  • £100 - in addition to inclusion on the Scroll of Supporters, you will be invited to attend the unveiling ceremony in December 2018. This will be a key moment in the Vote 100 Campaign, and will involve all local dignitaries, as well as national coverage - and a very cool event!
  • £250 - As well as the above, you will receive an invitation to attend the celebratory reception, with the opportunity to meet the artists, the team involved and the mayor. This is a unique opportunity to become part of a piece of local and national history, recognition of the significance of the suffragette movement and a cool Instagram moment...
  • £1000 - a bespoke supporter package - talk to us!
  • £5000 - ideal for corporate sponsorship, including a permanent plaque at the site.

The Impact

It feels strange to talk about the impact. For most of you who have come this far, you know what this means. Reversing the way history has made women invisible. Recognising the significance of the suffragette movement. Celebrating Bedford's central role in the campaign to create equality for all and revealing "hidden herstories"!

Bedford has an incredible history. Truly inspirational. There are some exciting, fascinating, powerful stories in our town's history. Uncovering these, sharing them in a substantial way, has the potential to change the way we see ourselves - to recognise the important, hidden people who have created the place we love today. By supporting this project, you will help to make this happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Share this page and encourage others to get involved!

THANK YOU. This is really important to us, and we hope you see how important it is, too.

story:
Short Summary (runterscrollen für Deutsch!!)

OPOTFOTF is a sensational soap opera that will take place at the Hellerau Europäische Zentrum der Künste Dresden in April 2019.  It will be a glorious affair largely closed off to you, the world outside of Dresden.  If you are in Dresden, we feel you owe us both of your eyeballs.  But this is only the tip of the iceberg that is OPOTFOTF.  Hold me Jack, because we are about to crash onto the soft underbelly of the project, laid out for you now in a viewing schedule involving spandex and water shoes. 

Things to remember: 

  • True nonsense comes from within each and every one of us. 
  • Many things in the world are real.  An infinite number of things are not only not real, but false. 
  • There is no spoon.

Keep it delicate, but ask yourself: when was the last time I put my money towards a caricature of a middle-aged super hero piling his soft underbelly into an iceberg, softly whispering, 'Hold me Jack'?

What We Need & What You... Get?

We'll beat the dead horse: 

  • We want you to give us money because life is absurd.  If we were speaking in mathematical terms, and we are not, no matter how quickly a piece of art approaches absolute nonsense, reality is always faster.  Reality is always more absurd than any piece of theater. 
  • We want you to join us in solidarity in this liminal space between reason, desperation, and defiance.  Fight fire with fire, nonsense with nonsense.  
  • Besides the spectacle of the century, you will be contributing to the other big part of the project:  this Indiegogo campaign.  All perks will be returned in the form of digital performance art and personalized anarchy, poetic terrorism, and subconscious shockwaves.  Through your donations, we will build an archive of dead manifestos embodied and flattened through smart phones, which you, our co-conspirators, can use as existential salve to soothe the banality of the Every Day Life.  We ask you to give your money willingly to something that cannot be said to have any tangible effect, but is instead more like throwing ice cubes into and against a blizzard.

The Impact (kaboom)

Look.  We already have some funding.  We know.  We were surprised as well.  With or without your contribution, OPOTFOTF will go forward, and hopefully annoy a certain handful of people here in Dresden while mildly entertaining another.

  • OPOTFOTF will not change anything, except maybe it will. 
  • You are better off contributing to this project if you would like to hear a randomly generated revolutionary cry shouted in a department store, or perhaps hear an elegy for a dead clam.
  • But you are the best off doing it because you believe in nothing and everything, and this might be a Fun Thing for you to do. 

Risks & Challenges

Quite possibly you will like very little of what we produce.  But you must not go tender into this dark line of thought.  Also, the more money you give us, the more likely we are to work with even more qualified artists.

  • Who will make more content for the World Wide Web.
  • Who would be grateful to be compensated for their Artist Work for their Food, Shelter, and Netflix.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel like you can contribute monetarily, that's ok. Most of us can't.  Take a look at the perks page and see if there's something you would like to try out yourself.  Do it for the joy of doing it or if you feel like it document your action and send it to us in the form of a video, picture, text, or whatever.  Preferably through the Internet but carrier pigeons accepted.  

  • Don't feel limited to our tasks.  If there is some kind of performative action that has been steadily clawing at the inside of your ribs then let that demon loose. 
  • Or get together as a group and do what you know you need to do.  One's company, but a crowd kills fascists.  (Or becomes them.)
  • Send us your content, through this campaign, or to our Instagram account _opotfotf https://www.instagram.com/_opotfotf_/.  Tell us if you would like for us to just see your work or if we also have the permission to use it, and how you would like to be credited.

And that's all there is to it.

 

Kurze Zusammenfassung

OPOTFOTF ist ein sensationsgeladenes Seifenoper-Musical, das im April 2019 im Europäischen Zentrum der Künste Dresden Hellerau aufgeführt wird. Wenn Sie in Dresden sind, schulden Sie uns Ihre ganze Aufmerksamkeit. Wenn Sie nicht in Dresden sind oder hier sein können, Dies ist jedoch nur die Spitze des Eisbergs OPOTFOTF. Halten Sie mich, Jack, denn wir sind im Begriff, auf die weiche Unterseite des Projekts zu stürzen.

Was ist zu beachten:

  • Wahrer Unsinn kommt aus jedem/r einzelnen von uns.
  • Viele Dinge auf der Welt sind echt. Eine unendliche Anzahl von Dingen ist nicht nur nicht echt, sondern auch falsch.
  • Es gibt keinen Löffel, oder Neo?

Fragen Sie sich: Wann habe ich zum letzten Mal mein Geld auf die Karikatur eines Superhelden mittleren Alters gelegt, der seinen weichen Unterboden auf einen Eisberg stapelte und leise flüsterte: "Halt mich, Jack"?

 

Was wir brauchen und was Sie ... bekommen?

We will beat the dead horse dt. Wir schlagen das tote Pferd.

Wir möchten, dass Sie uns Geld geben, weil das Leben absurd ist. Wenn wir in mathematischen Begriffen sprechen (und das tun wir nicht): egal wie schnell sich ein Kunstwerk dem absoluten Unsinn nähert, ist die Realität immer schneller. .

Wir möchten, dass Sie sich in diesem Grenzbereich zwischen Vernunft, Verzweiflung und Trotz engagieren. Bekämpfen wir Feuer mit Feuer, Unsinn mit Unsinn. Wir glauben, dass, damit das Gewebe des Universums den spontanen Vakuumzerfall abwehren kann, eine konstante, gleiche und entgegengesetzte Reaktion stattfinden muss, um uns vor uns selbst zu retten.

Neben dem Spektakel des Jahrhunderts, tragen Sie zum anderen großen Teil des Projekts bei: dieser Indiegogo-Kampagne. Alle *Perks* (so ne Art Geschenk) werden in Form von digitaler Performancekunst und personalisierter Anarchie, poetischem Terrorismus und unbewussten Schockwellen zurückgegeben. Sie werden Altruist, ob Sie wollen oder nicht. Durch Ihre Spenden werden wir ein Archiv von toten Manifesten aufbauen, die durch Smartphones verkörpert und platt gemacht werden, die Sie, unsere Mitverschwörer, als existenzielle Rettungshilfe verwenden können, um die Banalität des Alltagslebens zu lindern. Wir bitten Sie, Ihr Geld freiwillig für etwas zu geben, von dem nicht gesagt werden kann, dass es einen spürbaren Einfluss auf den unverständlichen Zustand unserer gegenwärtigen sozialen, politischen und wirtschaftlichen Situation hat, sondern eher wie das Werfen von Eiswürfeln gegen eine nahende Feuerwand. Ein Blizzard des globalen Kapitalismus, algorithmische Wahlen, Mauern, Zahnseide, Doggos, Demagogen, Incels, fortwährender Krieg, Krieg, Krieg, die Rechten und diese flache Erde, die von Sekunde zu Sekunde flacher wird.

 

Die Auswirkung (Kaboom)

Guck mal. Wir haben schon etwas Geld. Ja, wir sind auch überrascht. Mit oder ohne Ihren Beitrag wird OPOTFOTF voranschreiten und hoffentlich eine bestimmte Handvoll Leute hier in Dresden ärgern, und andere sanft unterhalten.

  • OPOTFOTF ändert nichts, oder vielleicht doch.
  • Wenn Sie einen zufällig generierten revolutionären Schrei in einem Kaufhaus hören möchten oder vielleicht eine Elegie für eine tote Muschel, können Sie zu diesem Projekt beitragen.
  • Aber Sie tun es am Besten, weil Sie an nichts und alles glauben, und dies könnte eine lustige Sache für Sie sein.

 

Risiken und Herausforderungen

Möglicherweise mögen Sie sehr wenig von dem, was wir produzieren. Aber Sie dürfen nicht solche dunklen Gedanken pflegen. Je mehr Geld Sie uns geben, desto wahrscheinlicher arbeiten wir mit noch mehr qualifizierten KünstlerInnen. Sie ermöglichen ein Dach über dem Kopf, Essen und das Netflixabo.

 

Andere Möglichkeiten, wie Sie helfen können

Wenn Sie nicht das Gefühl haben, dass Sie einen finanziellen Beitrag leisten können, ist das in Ordnung. Die meisten von uns können es einfach nicht. Werfen Sie einen Blick auf die Perks-Seite und sehen Sie, ob es etwas gibt, das Sie selbst ausprobieren möchten. Machen Sie es aus Freude an der Arbeit. Wenn Sie das Gefühl haben, dass Ihre Handlungen dokumentiert werden sollte, dann senden Sie es uns in Form eines Videos, eines Bildes, eines Textes oder was auch immer. Vorzugsweise über das Internet, aber Brieftauben werden akzeptiert.

Fühlen Sie sich nicht auf unsere Aufgaben beschränkt. Wenn es eine Art performative Aktion gibt, die sich ständig an der Innenseite Ihrer Rippen kratzt, dann lassen Sie den Dämon los. Oder treffen Sie sich als Gruppe und tun Sie, was Sie tun müssen.

Senden Sie uns Ihre Inhalte über diese Kampagne oder an unser Instagram-Konto _opotfotf https://www.instagram.com/_opotfotf_/. Sagen Sie uns, ob Sie möchten, dass wir nur Ihre Arbeit sehen, oder ob wir auch die Erlaubnis haben, sie zu nutzen.

Das wars.
story_txt:
Short Summary (runterscrollen für Deutsch!!)
OPOTFOTF is a sensational soap opera that will take place at the Hellerau Europäische Zentrum der Künste Dresden in April 2019.  It will be a glorious affair largely closed off to you, the world outside of Dresden.  If you are in Dresden, we feel you owe us both of your eyeballs.  But this is only the tip of the iceberg that is OPOTFOTF.  Hold me Jack, because we are about to crash onto the soft underbelly of the project, laid out for you now in a viewing schedule involving spandex and water shoes. 
Things to remember: 

True nonsense comes from within each and every one of us. 
Many things in the world are real.  An infinite number of things are not only not real, but false. 
There is no spoon.

Keep it delicate, but ask yourself: when was the last time I put my money towards a caricature of a middle-aged super hero piling his soft underbelly into an iceberg, softly whispering, 'Hold me Jack'?

What We Need & What You... Get?
We'll beat the dead horse: 

We want you to give us money because life is absurd.  If we were speaking in mathematical terms, and we are not, no matter how quickly a piece of art approaches absolute nonsense, reality is always faster.  Reality is always more absurd than any piece of theater. 
We want you to join us in solidarity in this liminal space between reason, desperation, and defiance.  Fight fire with fire, nonsense with nonsense.  
Besides the spectacle of the century, you will be contributing to the other big part of the project:  this Indiegogo campaign.  All perks will be returned in the form of digital performance art and personalized anarchy, poetic terrorism, and subconscious shockwaves.  Through your donations, we will build an archive of dead manifestos embodied and flattened through smart phones, which you, our co-conspirators, can use as existential salve to soothe the banality of the Every Day Life.  We ask you to give your money willingly to something that cannot be said to have any tangible effect, but is instead more like throwing ice cubes into and against a blizzard.


The Impact (kaboom)
Look.  We already have some funding.  We know.  We were surprised as well.  With or without your contribution, OPOTFOTF will go forward, and hopefully annoy a certain handful of people here in Dresden while mildly entertaining another.

OPOTFOTF will not change anything, except maybe it will. 
You are better off contributing to this project if you would like to hear a randomly generated revolutionary cry shouted in a department store, or perhaps hear an elegy for a dead clam.
But you are the best off doing it because you believe in nothing and everything, and this might be a Fun Thing for you to do. 


Risks & Challenges
Quite possibly you will like very little of what we produce.  But you must not go tender into this dark line of thought.  Also, the more money you give us, the more likely we are to work with even more qualified artists.

Who will make more content for the World Wide Web.
Who would be grateful to be compensated for their Artist Work for their Food, Shelter, and Netflix.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you don't feel like you can contribute monetarily, that's ok. Most of us can't.  Take a look at the perks page and see if there's something you would like to try out yourself.  Do it for the joy of doing it or if you feel like it document your action and send it to us in the form of a video, picture, text, or whatever.  Preferably through the Internet but carrier pigeons accepted.  

Don't feel limited to our tasks.  If there is some kind of performative action that has been steadily clawing at the inside of your ribs then let that demon loose. 
Or get together as a group and do what you know you need to do.  One's company, but a crowd kills fascists.  (Or becomes them.)
Send us your content, through this campaign, or to our Instagram account _opotfotf https://www.instagram.com/_opotfotf_/.  Tell us if you would like for us to just see your work or if we also have the permission to use it, and how you would like to be credited.

And that's all there is to it. Kurze ZusammenfassungOPOTFOTF ist ein sensationsgeladenes Seifenoper-Musical, das im April 2019 im Europäischen Zentrum der Künste Dresden Hellerau aufgeführt wird. Wenn Sie in Dresden sind, schulden Sie uns Ihre ganze Aufmerksamkeit. Wenn Sie nicht in Dresden sind oder hier sein können, Dies ist jedoch nur die Spitze des Eisbergs OPOTFOTF. story:
Time to Create Some New Kalashnikov Patches

Contributors will get a FULL set of our new Kalashnikov Patch Designs

  • One New BIG Patch Design
  • New Spam Can Design
  • Funny Kalashnikov Design
  • & More Designs with Stretch Goals

Like Patches & Kalashnikov Stuff ??

We Got What You Need

& Here is What You Get

The Perks:

  • $9 - Single Random Kalash Patch (Shipped FREE to USA)
  • $30 - Set of Kalash Batch Patch (Shipped FREE to USA)
  • $60 - Two (2) Sets of Kalash Batch Patch (Shipped FREE to USA)

The Details:

  • We will make as many Patch Designs as possible
  • Three (3) Kalashnikov Patch Designs for sure
  • The more funds we raise, the more patch Designs we will make
  • Full Color, PVC, Velcro Backing (with that 2nd peice of velcro too)

The Patch Designs

The 1st Kalash Patch will be a BIG Kalshnikov design
a 9-inch long full color AKM 
We Created this one LIVE on GunChannels.com

---------------------------------


The second Kalash Patch will be our NEW Spam Can Design
a Hungarian 7.62x54R Spam Can

---------------------------------

The third Kalash Patch design will be another fun one
Wolverines 3

---------------------------------


The Project Timeline

This project is already underway, the designs will be finalized while the fundraisng is LIVE
The patches will be created, and shipped to backers in Aug 2019

  • June 20th - Project goes LIVE
  • Late June - Create the Patches LIVE on GunChannels.com
  • End of June - Art to the Manufacturers
    Hope to see a few patch samples before the campaign ends
  • July 7th - Fundraisng Ends
  • Late July - Patch Manufacturing Finished 
  • Early - Mid August - Sets shipped out to Backers

Our Target is to get these Kalash Patches in your hands
before Red Dawn Day (Aug 10th)


The Stretch Goals

The more people join in, the costs go down (except shipping) 
And the more designs we will add to the this Kalash Batch Set

  • $3,000 - 4th Patch Design Added

    When we reach the goals and do a 4th patch, we will set up a poll to allow backers to vote on a design from some potential designs
     
  • $4,000 - 5th Patch Design Added

    When we reach the goals and do a 5th patch, we will set up a poll to allow backers to vote on a design from some potential designs
     
  • $5,000 - 6th Patch Design Added

    When we reach the goals and do a 6th patch, we will set up a poll to allow backers to vote on a design from some potential designs


The Impact of this project

Is difficult to measure, but Will this Kalash Patch Set make your patch panel cooler? YES

YOU can help make this project successful

  • Make a video describing why this project MUST be funded !!
  • Create a cool Post about Why this Project MUST reach the Stretch Goals !!
  • Don't let the Communists Win

Risks & Challenges

After more than 30 successful projects, and many years in the Patch Game, there is little risk of any problem with this project

  • We use vendors we have worked with for years
  • We ship every perk ourselves, Tracked and Insured 

Even if you Hate Patches, You Can Help

If you are not interested, or able to participate, you can still help the project

  • Help get the word out
  • Make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools

Thank You

story:
Actually, we were able to give 12 artists free residencies this year, pay 3 artists to create murals, raise more money for artists with our festival, and go harder as a mutual aid and community support space. Not fucking bad for 2020...

Thanks for all the support, it would not have been possible without all of you. It’s been powerful and important for SC to maintain these past 10 months but it’s time to make a shift. 

We’re moving out of the 1100 building and could use some help in the transition. All money raised here goes to getting out of our beloved basement and securing a storage space for the flooring, seating, and tech gear so we can keep it safe while we’re in flux.

It costs 40K a year to keep SC going - and in the realm of venues for art that’s hardly anything. If you have a rich uncle that wants a tax write off hit us up, otherwise... please consider donating a few dollars so we can reemerge when it’s possible.

Apologies for the no perks situation. Perhaps the thought of SC existing again in the future is perky enough for now?

We will be selling limited edition SC tshirts:

white with black distressed classic SC logo

and

black with bleach splatter classic SC logo

All proceeds from these sales will also go toward transition/storage space

We miss you all so much and look forward to when we can be together again. Our mission is to support participation in the arts centering experimental, queer, fringe, and BIPOC artists. We are not done with that, this is just where we are right now.

story:
WHEN:

Saturday, August 8th at 8 PM EDT


WHAT:

During the COVID-19 outbreak, vulnerable communities around the globe need support more than ever. In an effort to fundraise for said communities, DJ Bassam Haddad has launched, "In My House." This project includes the live-streamed house sessions by DJ Bassam. As the music moves its listeners to dance in their home-quarantine, we hope that it will also move listeners to donate what they can to support those suffering from the impact of this pandemic. For each session played, the DJ Bassam will donate $200 to the organization being promoted for that session.

This week's Livestream, “International Beast: Non-Stop High Energy Global Rhythms,” will benefit the DC Palestinian Film & Arts Festival (DCPFAF). The DCPFAF champions the work of Palestinian artists and filmmakers in Palestine and in diaspora, showcasing the range and complexity of Palestinian identities and narratives. 


WHERE:

To learn more about this and every live stream session, visit/watch at inmyhouse.live and on DJ Bassam's Facebook page!


WHY GIVE TO DCPFAF: 

The DCPFAF is a volunteer-run 501c3 nonprofit that has drawn national and international attention for providing a unique platform in the District for Palestinian filmmakers and artists. Due to the global pandemic, we are dedicated to giving our community the annual festival in a safe and responsible way. As we pivot to a digital festival, we need the support of our community  to broadcast Palestinian voices, stories, and art to audiences in DC and around the world!

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN HAS NOT ENDED! Go HERE to contribute to All Eyes Wide and Gate II @ Arches LIVE!

 

Thank you so much to all those who have contributed to All Eyes Wide and Gate II so far!

Together you have raised $270 (��166.50) which will make a big difference to the quality of the installation and the experience of everyone who attends. We have also been given $648 (��400) worth of materials we wanted making a total of $918 (��566.50) raised so far!!

We now have just over one week before our get-in day, and the last chance to source materials and technical equipment, so we’ve decided to relaunch the campaign for a final push towards our target.

http://www.indiegogo.com/gateIIfinalpush?a=1018576

Remember – every penny we raise will make Gate II one penny better for everyone. All the same perks that tempted you before are still available, so dig deep and share widely for our last week and our final push!

AND DON’T FORGET TO BOOK YOUR TICKETS TO SEE WHERE YOUR GATE LEADS! http://www.thearches.co.uk/events/arts/all-eyes-wide-gate-ii


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Earlier this year, All Eyes Wide created an installation together called Gate which opened at the Sound Thought Festival hosted by the Arches in Glasgow. All Eyes Wide is the name given to the collaboration between Glasgow based artists, Edward Crawley and Rob Jones.

Gate I as we now refer to it was very successful but it made us realise there was heaps of potential in our idea and that with a bit more support and more creative development it could be something really amazing and really valuable to our cultural landscape.

Gate II is a playful experiment into sensorial immersion for two audience members at a time. When you arrive at the installation you take your shoes and socks off, are given wireless headphones and blindfolded. You are then paired with another audience member in the exact same position and set free, hand in hand, to explore the installation. As your feet come into contact with different environments and different textures, the soundscape you are hearing through your headphones changes depending on where you are in the room and how you choose to respond.

It’s an investigation into human negotiation and collaboration as well as a means of taking people out of the sensory overload of everyday life, allowing them to feel the subtleties of their senses once again and how these fire our imagination and enliven our spirit.

We found with Gate I that it’s also naturally a very playful experience and can feel like a game being played out between Edward, Rob and the audience as they test the boundaries of the sound geography and how Edward and Rob react to their movements.

What we need and what you get

In order to make the experience as immersive as possible and so that you feel like you’re free to explore a vast landscape, we need some extra support to acquire many of the physical materials you meet in the installation. The ‘stuff’ that makes up the environments you will experience. So that the soundscape can be as dynamic and as responsive as your choice of actions in the space there is certain technical equipment that will make it possible for us to keep up with your movements and responses as they occur in the moment.

Whether we manage to raise these funds or not, Gate II will be realised for Arches Live 2012 but the more we raise the better the journey will be for our audience. The technical equipment we would like, such as high quality head-phones and midi controller, can be used again and again so your support would extend further than this one performance.

As All Eyes Wide, we fully intend to keep developing our immersive, interactive work and hope to tour future Gates, maybe even worldwide if we can. Every penny you contribute will take us closer to this dream and help to bring this new exciting work to a wider audience.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is not all we need! There are plenty of other ways you can help.

You can copy the link in the address bar and post it on your Facebook, tweet it or even put it in your blog. Do you know a rich philanthropist? A company that may want to fund us (perhaps they make high-end headphones?); feel free to share our links with them. You can even pass on our email address: alleyeswide@gmail.com.

Tell your friends about Gate II!

#gateII

#archeslive

@gateIIArches 

 

**Some rewards can only be claimed if you attend the performance. Book early to avoid disappointment. Limited places are available for preview shows/rehearsals if you are unable to attend the performances. Please email alleyeswide@gmail.com for more information**
story_txt:
THIS CAMPAIGN HAS NOT ENDED! Go HERE to contribute to All Eyes Wide and Gate II @ Arches LIVE!
 
Thank you so much to all those who have contributed to All Eyes Wide and Gate II so far!
Together you have raised $270 (��166.50) which will make a big difference to the quality of the installation and the experience of everyone who attends. We have also been given $648 (��400) worth of materials we wanted making a total of $918 (��566.50) raised so far!!
We now have just over one week before our get-in day, and the last chance to source materials and technical equipment, so we’ve decided to relaunch the campaign for a final push towards our target.
http://www.indiegogo.com/gateIIfinalpush?a=1018576
Remember – every penny we raise will make Gate II one penny better for everyone. All the same perks that tempted you before are still available, so dig deep and share widely for our last week and our final push!
AND DON’T FORGET TO BOOK YOUR TICKETS TO SEE WHERE YOUR GATE LEADS! http://www.thearches.co.uk/events/arts/all-eyes-wide-gate-ii

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Earlier this year, All Eyes Wide created an installation together called Gate which opened at the Sound Thought Festival hosted by the Arches in Glasgow. All Eyes Wide is the name given to the collaboration between Glasgow based artists, Edward Crawley and Rob Jones.
Gate I as we now refer to it was very successful but it made us realise there was heaps of potential in our idea and that with a bit more support and more creative development it could be something really amazing and really valuable to our cultural landscape.
Gate II is a playful experiment into sensorial immersion for two audience members at a time. When you arrive at the installation you take your shoes and socks off, are given wireless headphones and blindfolded. You are then paired with another audience member in the exact same position and set free, hand in hand, to explore the installation. As your feet come into contact with different environments and different textures, the soundscape you are hearing through your headphones changes depending on where you are in the room and how you choose to respond.
It’s an investigation into human negotiation and collaboration as well as a means of taking people out of the sensory overload of everyday life, allowing them to feel the subtleties of their senses once again and how these fire our imagination and enliven our spirit.
We found with Gate I that it’s also naturally a very playful experience and can feel like a game being played out between Edward, Rob and the audience as they test the boundaries of the sound geography and how Edward and Rob react to their movements.
What we need and what you get
In order to make the experience as immersive as possible and so that you feel like you’re free to explore a vast landscape, we need some extra support to acquire many of the physical materials you meet in the installation. The ‘stuff’ that makes up the environments you will experience. So that the soundscape can be as dynamic and as responsive as your choice of actions in the space there is certain technical equipment that will make it possible for us to keep up with your movements and responses as they occur in the moment.
Whether we manage to raise these funds or not, Gate II will be realised for Arches Live 2012 but the more we raise the better the journey will be for our audience. The technical equipment we would like, such as high quality head-phones and midi controller, can be used again and again so your support would extend further than this one performance.
As All Eyes Wide, we fully intend to keep developing our immersive, interactive work and hope to tour future Gates, maybe even worldwide if we can. Every penny you contribute will take us closer to this dream and help to bring this new exciting work to a wider audience.
Other Ways You Can Help
Money is not all we need! There are plenty of other ways you can help.
You can copy the link in the address bar and post it on your Facebook, tweet it or even put it in your blog. Do you know a rich philanthropist? A company that may want to fund us (perhaps they make high-end headphones?); feel free to share our links with them. You can even pass on our email address: alleyeswide@gmail.com.
Tell your friends about Gate II!
#gateII
#archeslive
@gateIIArches 
 
**Some rewards can only be claimed if you attend the performance. Book early to avoid disappointment. Limited places are available for preview shows/rehearsals if you are unable to attend the performances. Please email alleyeswide@gmail.com for more information**

story:
Thank you to everyone who helped us to meet our goal! If you wish to learn more about how you can be a Working Artist, visit us at WWW.THEWORKINGARTIST.COM

It's everything they never taught in art school!

Crista Cloutier has taught The Working Artist master class to artists and photographers throughout the world. Using what she has learned from her extensive background in the art business as a dealer, publisher, appraiser, curator, gallerist, and artist herself, Crista has a unique understanding of the challenges artists face, and she gives artists the tools they need to create a successful career. Join us in bringing The Working Artist online, as a downloadable program, so any artist, anywhere, can have access to this essential and practical knowledge.

The script is written, the artwork is ready, and the class has been taught to hundreds and hundreds of artists and photographers internationally. It works. Your support for The Working Artist will allow us to film and edit this two and a half hour program, and to create the embedded workbook. It will also cover the very groovy incentives we are offering: exclusive interviews with artists who are at the top of their game as they discuss success and their work practices. We are also offering private consultations with Crista, and even artwork by Kiki Smith! Additional funds raised will allow greater production values to make it an even better program, and will also go toward the creation of an online artists' community, bringing working artists the essential opportunity to receive support from one another.

LEARN MORE  www.theworkingartist.com

"Good business is the best art." Andy Warhol

"I found the workshop powerful and not at all what I had imagined." Deborah Phillips, Artist, London

"This class was worth every penny - really, priceless." Taunya van der Steen-Mizel, New York

"Crista, you truly are 'The Artist Whisperer." Benn Abdy-Collins, London

"Such stunning advice..." Heidi Benn, Capetown

"95% of the artists I know should take this class." James Robischon, Robischin gallery, Denver

"Crista is the most knowledgeable person in the art world that I know. In the workshop she ties together the artist, the marketing, and the buyer. She helps the artist put into words that what we need to attract buyers. She is sensitive to the artist and the dilemmas that we face, but helps them understand the need to run their art as a business – and she supplies the tools to do that. Crista will turn your art practice into a more profitable business and help you to be a better artist because of the questions she asks and the goals that she helps you to create for yourself." Kent Corbin, Artist, Scottsdale

  

PLEASE HELP US TO SPREAD THE WORD ABOUT OUR CAMPAIGN!

MAKE SOME NOISE!

story:
I was born in Accra, Ghana. I have two older sisters and very supportive parents. My
dad managed a small poultry farm behind our home and my mum ran a small restaurant from the farm.

The restaurant was their only means of support for our education. It started well, but
soon buckled under the ever-failing economy. But we were doing ok. Back then, life was very simple, and I dreamed that I would become an artist who spoke ﬂuent French. I don’t know why I chose this.

My parents worked very hard to put me through some of the best schools in Ghana.
They even dared to push us out to the States, where they supported my studies at
Mount Holyoke College. I’m blessed: only 5% of Ghanaians achieve higher education.
Most Ghanaian families can’t afford even basic education, and some kids don’t even
survive their ﬁrst bout of malaria.

This is how I left Ghana: my dad walked me to the airport entrance, hugged me and
then watched me leave. I must have been 18 or so. Everything changed in that moment. I didn’t realize that a chunk of my adulthood was going to be spent apart from the people who worked so hard to push me this far.

It was very daring of me to double major in French and Studio Art rather than a more
‘useful’ area of study. My decision was met with a lot of opposition. I still remember
hearing things like “African students don’t come to the US to study Art,” and “Art is a
waste of time - what are you going to do with the rest of your life?” It also meant that,unlike most of my African peers who end up on Wall Street, I wasn’t going to be
guaranteed success in the US. This didn’t deter me though.

Art and French at MHC opened up so many opportunities. After studying in Montpelier, I now speak French ﬂuently. I also wrote a thesis and had my portraits displayed in an exhibition. This year I was accepted into the Parsons Paris School of Design for Visual Communications and awarded $14,748 (€12,000) in scholarships.

This program is going to be my launchpad. I have $16,716 (€13,600) left to cover after my scholarship. My aim is to raise half this amount, then support myself by working while I study. I’m in ﬁnal interviews for a job in Paris. If you can help me raise $9,190 (€6,800), I will be able to afford the monthly tuition plan and make more art.

If you are unable to donate monetarily, please share my story. Supporting my efforts at Parsons means supporting a rare African woman with the desire to bless you with her he[art]. If you would like something in return for your donations, please email me at ofo.obuobi@gmail.com and I can:
- Feature you in my Facebook portrait series
- Send you prints of my work
- Design a poster for an event and/or be your photographer

Thank you so much for your support. Mille fois merci! Medawase bebree, Nyame nshira
wo!

story:
Hello!

I'm Crystal Minnerick, a senior at Western Michigan University currently working towards a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Graphic Design. This campaign will support my first study abroad experience! We will be traveling to Venice, Florence, Cornuda, and Vernoa in Italy to study art history, book arts, and typography. The class will run from May 16 – June 8.

As a graphic designer, I've always had a strong interest in art and typography. Going to Italy (which has some of the most important art of the Renaissance) will be a dream come true. 

Overview

Not only will we be visiting historic libraries, sites, and mueseums, but we will also have a rare opportunity to work in the historic book arts facilities at the Scuola di Grafica Internazionale in Venice (http://www.scuolagrafica.it), Firenze Arti Visive in Florence (http://www.firenze-artivisive.org), and Tipoteca Italiana Fondazione in Cornuda (http://www.tipoteca.it).

We will create a limited-edition book written and illustrated by the members of the class, containing intaglio images, text printed on antique presses using movable type, and hand bookbinding.

For more information about the program, please visit: http://broncosabroad.international.wmich.edu/index.cfm?FuseAction=programs.ViewProgram&Program_ID=255

 

Your Contributions

The program fee for this Study Abroad trip is $4,300 and the airfare will be around $1500, so all of the proceeds from this campaign will go to cover those costs.

Perks

I understand that money is hard to come by, so I want to share my experience with the people who help make this trip happen. I'm offering beautiful photo wallpapers, prints, and books that incorporate entries from my daily journal so that contributers can have a personal reminder of the experience that would be impossible without their donations.

 

Results

This study abroad trip will be a dream come true. It will help me be a more educated and cultured student. It will also enhance the repertoire of my portfolio, making me a more desireable employee.

Our daily journals, intaglio prints, and completed letterpress publication will be part of an exhibition in the fall of 2013 at the Kalamazoo Book Arts Center (in Kalamazoo, MI) to share the students' experience with the community. Please be sure to come see it!

 

Other ways you can help out!

Please spread the word about my campaign! Indiegogo allows you to post links to all sorts of social media sites!

story:
Привет ! На русском 

Hello !

We are Dmitry and Irina from Russia.

Now starting our project Homeri for hand made masters.

The idea was born when we looked at the European websites that helps people to sell their handmade items. We realized that our market is so big, but there are only few ways of selling handmade stuff. The main problem of them is that masters have to pay for each item just to be in the list.

That’s how we start Homeri – selective art market, where masters will not pay for listing. We will choose only the best masters to be in Homeri store.

While we are doing our online-shop, we started with blog  (http://blog.homeri.ru)  and social networks in Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/SelectiveHomeArt) and Vk.com (http://vk.com/homeri)

We realize that its only for Russains now, but you can understand the main idea by viewing the pictures.

The main amount of investments is online shop itself wich will be really flexible for users and vendors.

Total amount for it is $6000 (which is software, design and other spenses).  

We already invested about $3000 for starting website and social promotion.

The opening day will be in the middle of May and we will show you the result !

 

We will appreciate any help from you ! Not only money !

Just like us on facebook or send the link to the friend.

 

What we can give to you ?

First off all is our appreciation – we will say about you on our special page.

Or you’ll get a coupon to get some items from the website for free (we will send it to you by mail)

Thanks in advance for you support !

You can contact us by facebook (http://www.facebook.com/dmitriy.smetanin.3)
or Skype: dimassrus

 _________________________

Привет!
Мы Дмитрий и Ирина.
Мы стартуем handmade проект Homeri.ru.
Эта идея родилась когда мы увидели европейские сайты
которые помогают людям продать изделия ручной
работы.
В России потребность в реализации hand made велика,
но рынок не сформирован. Большинство магазинов
требуют взносы за размещение товаров.
Именно по этой причине был создан Homeri !
Мы решили,что несправедливо брать плату лишь за
размещение мастером своего товара,т.е мы взымаем
процент только с факта продажи.При этом выбираем
только очень качественный и эксклюзивный товар для
размещения в нашем маркете! И берём на себя все
затраты на поисковое продвижение и платную рекламу!

Общая сумма инвестиций составила 6000$, но мы уже
вложили около 3000$.Понимаем,что в нашей стране
очень многие люди с проблемами здоровья нуждаются в
помощи,но мы расчитываем на более широкое мышление и
взгляды.И на вашу помощь и вклад в проект homeri.ru,
не безвозмездно , мы вернём вам вклад в виде
презентов,конечно handmade-)
