story:
To you our donors, who have supported us once again for the Burning Man installation, our apologies for this late notice on pdropping the project. Due to unforseen circumstances we are unable to attend Burning Man for the amount of time which such a project requires. But, we will be back - hopefully next year.

 

This is our third Burning Man art installation marrying social commentary, spiritual pursuit, art and fire.

DESCRIPTION
How Crate Thou Art is a fun house built inside a two story space designed to look like stacked wooden cargo crates. An 8' cube placed atop a 12' cube forms the fun house space.

Participants will be challenged on issues of self discovery. Illusions such as the famous "Ames Room", a scavenger hunt for your self image, and discovery of the key to your enemy's heart will turn the concept of seeking self fulfillment upside down.

Once on top of the installation a person will face their own dreams and sense of destiny with a new perspective on life.

THE NAME
"How Crate Thou Art" is a play on words from the famous hymn "How Great Thou Art." A self absorbed search for self discovery often leads to stunted and limited growth. We become boxed inside ourselves by searching into the limited landscape of our own inner life. How Crate Thou Art challenges self discovery without the outside resources of sacrificial love toward others, or lessons from God.

Part of the lesson from How Crate Thou Art will include considering the question, "What if your life were cntained in a box?" This is a challenge to our capitalistic culture.

MATERIALS
This is an almost entirely wooden project, which will be burned following the display. Yes, burned. We love burning our projects to the ground. It is Burning Man after all, and that's what people do. Wood costs a lot these days, and so most of the cost goes to purchasing the stuff to build with. We have lighting, and art supplies from the last two years of Burning Man projects to help create the funhouse elements inside the two story structure.

OUR SUCCESS
Our story was told in a feature article in Christianity Today in the July/August edition 2012. All supporters will receive the full color photo pdf of that article. The less artistic version can be found online here.
story_txt:
To you our donors, who have supported us once again for the Burning Man installation, our apologies for this late notice on pdropping the project. Due to unforseen circumstances we are unable to attend Burning Man for the amount of time which such a project requires. But, we will be back - hopefully next year.
 
This is our third Burning Man art installation marrying social commentary, spiritual pursuit, art and fire.
DESCRIPTIONHow Crate Thou Art is a fun house built inside a two story space designed to look like stacked wooden cargo crates. An 8' cube placed atop a 12' cube forms the fun house space.
Participants will be challenged on issues of self discovery. Illusions such as the famous "Ames Room", a scavenger hunt for your self image, and discovery of the key to your enemy's heart will turn the concept of seeking self fulfillment upside down.
Once on top of the installation a person will face their own dreams and sense of destiny with a new perspective on life.
THE NAME"How Crate Thou Art" is a play on words from the famous hymn "How Great Thou Art." A self absorbed search for self discovery often leads to stunted and limited growth. We become boxed inside ourselves by searching into the limited landscape of our own inner life. How Crate Thou Art challenges self discovery without the outside resources of sacrificial love toward others, or lessons from God.
Part of the lesson from How Crate Thou Art will include considering the question, "What if your life were cntained in a box?" This is a challenge to our capitalistic culture.
MATERIALSThis is an almost entirely wooden project, which will be burned following the display. Yes, burned. We love burning our projects to the ground. It is Burning Man after all, and that's what people do. Wood costs a lot these days, and so most of the cost goes to purchasing the stuff to build with. We have lighting, and art supplies from the last two years of Burning Man projects to help create the funhouse elements inside the two story structure.
OUR SUCCESSOur story was told in a feature article in Christianity Today in the July/August edition 2012. All supporters will receive the full color photo pdf of that article. The less artistic version can be found online here.

story:
You Are Loved - You Are Important -You Are Needed
             You Are Beautiful - You Can Do It

These are messages everyone longs to hear and feel. We are bringing this message to Socorro schools.

We are Lily Ward and Alex Cook, a sister and a brother. :) Lily is the mom of 2 at Parkview Elementary and 1 at Socorro High School. Alex has created over 100 murals in the US and abroad since 1997. (www.stonebalancer.com) He is also the creator of the YOU ARE LOVED mural project (https://www.facebook.com/YOUARELOVEDMMP) We are teaming up to combat negativity, fear, and bullying in Socorro schools by creating beautiful, powerful, supportive murals in these 2 schools.

What We Need & What You Get

We are working to raise $2500 to pay for the creation of these 2 murals. We have been organizing the project since January and will be painting the murals in the last week of March and the first week of April.

This amount covers our costs
travel - $300
supplies $200
Indiegogo rewards $200
Lily's time: organizing the walls with the schools, talking with the Chamber of Commerce, communicating with students and teachers, painting $700
Alex's time: designing the murals, developing the project idea, facilitating students painting, and painting the murals $1200

The Impact

Imagine the words "You Are Loved," as the substance of a mural - the letters, 12 feet tall, covering the side of a public school in your community. Imagine the words "You Can Do It," painted, not just as a sign, but made artfully, beautifully, causing community members to stop and look, moved by the beauty of the painting, internalizing the power of the message. Imagine the internal conversations it will cause when people read "You Are Needed" emblazoned on a public wall, undercutting all the voices that fill our public spaces, the internet, and public thought testifying to the opposite. You can make this happen.

Imagine the young woman, struggling with fears about her appearance, drinking in a confident, colorful mural declaring "You Are Beautiful" instead of the belittling message of sex-based advertising. Imagine a young man struggling to find work encountering an unequivocal public statement that "You Are Needed." Such bold expressions will cause people to think and feel in new and more hopeful ways. Many will simply see the beauty, feel the message, and be uplifted and renewed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word about this project! Share our fundraiser on your Facebook wall! Tell your friends about it and come visit us while we are painting!

story:
A Very Fun Book

Super Art Activity Fun Book--Saskatchewan Edition is an activity book about visual art in the province of Saskatchewan from 1950 to the present.

I'm a full-time visual artist with a background in design and an interest in the social lives of visual artists and their institutions. Super Art Activity Fun Book reenvisions classic children’s word games for an adult audience: word searches, mad libs, mazes, crossword puzzles, dot-to-dots, logic games, and more. Super Art Activity Fun Book doesn't just provide textbook facts on well-known Saskatchewan artists -- it's chock full of surprising stories and anecdotes that bring provincial art to life.


What I'll Do

With the help of the Saskatchewan Arts Board and the Banff Centre for the Arts, I've spent nearly two years researching, writing, and designing this 40-page book. Now, with your support, I'm ready to print and distribute it.

Your contribution will print an initial run of 300 copies of Super Fun Art Activity Book. The 8.5"x11"  book will be digitally printed in black and white, with a glossy full-colour cover, and saddle stitched.

Games include:

  • A Full Set of Teeth
  • 38 Kinds of Burger
  • On a Shoestring
  • Bornstein's Bros
  • Boy, Oh Buffalo Boy!

Example spread of two puzzles about Queer City Cinema and the Lieutenant Governor's Arts Awards.

Some art-speak:

By positioning the “specialist” knowledge of contemporary art in a fun context usually occupied by "basic information", Super Art Activity Fun Book challenges public assumptions about whether art’s disciplinary concerns have wider significance (as I argue they do). Super Art Activity Fun Book's cheeky, nostalgic games encourage exploration, while teaching visual literacy and art historical knowledge. At the same time, humour soothes the sting that comes from interrogating institutions, regionalisms, and artistic canon.

I made this 7"x8.5" activity book zine as part of a 2013 residency at Artspace Artist-Run Centre in Peterborough, ON.

What You'll Get

Contributors will receive a variety of FUN ART made by me. There are a lot of choices, depending on your budget and enthusiasm:

  • $10 A special thank you NOTE and a hug (or enthusiastic grinning and waving, your choice).
  • $15 A COPY of Super Art Activity Fun Book--Saskatchewan Edition. That's what you want, right? Plus a note.
  • $25 Your NAME will be included in a secret super special puzzle in the book! Plus a copy and the other stuff.
  • $35 Everything above plus a bonus selection of other paper game MULTIPLES from the past few years. This could include bingo cards, word searches & crosswords, activity placemats, or zine. These works are mostly about art, cities, and the queer archive. It's a surprise!
  • $50 A fusible plastic bead HANKIE in any colour of your choice! 5" square. Flag your favourite colour on your office door or above your bed. Plus everything above.
  • $75 Set of 3 fusible bead CAT HEAD ORNAMENTS. Each approx. 4". Wow, awesome! Plus multiples, note, and the book with your name in a puzzle.
  • $100 An 8"x10" fusible plastic bead PORTRAIT of a contemporary Saskatchewan artist. Just the head. It's a surprise! It could be anyone! Who will it be?... Plus multiples, note, and the book with your name in a puzzle.
  • $150 A portrait of a CAT (or other pet) of your choice, just for you, made from candy-coloured fusible plastic beads. Approx. 10"x14" Plus multiples, note, and the book with your name in a puzzle.
  • $300 Set of 3 8"x10" HEADS of artists. Not real heads, fusible bead ones. You can specify people, pick a theme (e.g. abstract expressionists, queer performance artists who can play the euphonium, people named "Andrew") or let me decide...if you dare! Plus multiples, note, and the book with your name in a puzzle.
  • $500 An 8"x10" NEEDLEPOINT PORTRAIT of any person of your choice. Up to 10 colours of yarn on plastic canvas, framed as a box and ready to hang. You supply the photograph. Plus multiples, note, and the book with your name in a puzzle.

Below are a few examples of what you can expect to receive, in return for your contribution:

Perler bead heads, 10" high. This is David Hoffos. (If you get a set of three, they could be all different people, or the same like these. Your choice!)

Perler bead cats. Esther & Tucker.

Needlepoint portrait, 10"x7" (slightly smaller than the one I'll sew for you). This is architect Adolf Loos.

Postage/delivery within Canada is included. Books and paper items will be mailed in April. Custom items take more time; dates of delivery to the side are estimates and subject to change based on popularity.

The Impact

Contributors rest in the happy glow of having done done something great for not just me, but hundreds of other artists with ties to Saskatchewan. Meeting my fundraising goal will mean that lots of people will have the chance to earn about Saskatchewan art.

This campaign will fund printing the book, including related production costs, taxes, shipping, and Indiegogo fees. If, with your help, I can't meet my goal, I will print fewer books at a higher cost per copy. If we exceed my $1,600 goal, additional funds will be directed toward postage and distribution (getting the book into the hands of the galleries and organizations that will sell it), then additional copies -- and maybe even a launch party!

Thank you for supporting local art!

About Me

Raised in Minnesota, I lived in Saskatoon, SK for over 15 years. I'm a full-time artist currently based in Lethbridge, Alberta, with my partner who is in graduate school. My artistic practice explores the roles of gossip, storytelling, and play in establishing the professional identities of artists and cultural workers. I've created interactive word games for solo exhibitions of at the Art Gallery of Alberta and Artspace (Peterborough, ON), presented games at public art festivals, and published crosswords in art magazines. My fibre and fusible bead portrait work has shown at artist-run centres across Canada.

Visit my website for more information about my practice.

Frequently Asked Questions

"Is this a history book?"

No! Super Art Activity Fun Book--Saskatchewan Edition is NOT intended as a comprehensive survey of art in the province. It is cheeky and highly biased toward art I personally think is interesting, contentious, or has didactic potential. I am neither a curator nor a historian (although I think curators and historians are awesome). I am a visual artist, and also an art fan.

"Is this for kids?"

Not specifically! It looks like a children's book, but it's actually aimed at adults. If you give it to your kids they will love some bits and may not quite understand others, but there is nothing in it that you'd need to hide from them. -- Unless discussion of queerness or colonialism offends you, in which case this book is probably not for you.

"But I don't know much about art..."

That's ok! With a few exceptions (the crosswords), puzzles require no knowledge of art.

"Where is Saskatchewan?"

In the middle of the Canadian prairie (north of North Dakota). It is full of wheat and uranium, and was the birthplace of medicare (publicly-funded medicine). Contrary to popular belief, it is also full of artists.

"So why do I care about Saskatchewan art?"

Don't buy into urban-centric art historical narratives which would have you believe that important contemporary art only happens in big (read: American) cities! It's not true. Art is all over.

Super Art Activity Fun Book--Saskatchewan Edition embraces the province's fantastic and terrible regionalism, and all its weird/monotonous/shocking stories.

In Super Art Activity Fun Book I give Saskatchewan a hug, then I pull down its pants.

Ways to Help without $

  • Tell your friends about Super Art Activity Fun Book--Saskatchewan Edition!
  • Help promote the project by sharing it on Twitter, Tumblr, Facebook, or on the wall of your favourite bathroom stall.
  • If you work at a gallery with a store, message me about getting books to sell.
  • Go see local art!

story:
About ME 

I am a Syrian-American activist and humanitarian currently pursuing my Master's degree in International Development and Humanitarian Emergencies at the London School of Economics. This summer, I will be joining a group of 30 mentors from around the world at the Salam School in Reyhanli, Turkey as part of Karam Foundation's ZEITOUNA project. Together, we will work with over 600 of the most high-risk Syrian children who have been denied access to school for more than year as a result of the devastating war in Syria. My goal is to raise money to implement an art workshop that I designed for nearly 200 kids grades 1-3. 

Workshop CONCEPT

Each child partaking in the workshop will receive pieces of scratch-art colored paper and be asked to cut out the shape of a star. Scratch-art colored paper is a special material with a black surface that is drawn on using a wooden tool to reveal either bright fluorescent colors or gold and silver underneath. On their scratch-art stars, children will be encouraged to draw a picture of a favorite memory, dream, or hope. Each child will then have the opportunity to share his/her pictures, discussing the motivations behind them and the feelings associated with the memory. At the end of the workshop, we will hang all of the stars on a banner to display in their classroom, creating a sky of memories and hope that will last with them during this difficult and chaotic time. 

Some examples of scratch-art drawings: 



Workshop PURPOSE

This workshop is designed to entertain the children, while incorporating critically important art therapy for those that have suffered traumatic experiences and forced displacement. Art therapy allows for children to process and express their emotions in a health, non-violent way. It encompasses healing qualities that have been proven effective across cultures. It helps to increase awareness of self, cope with stress, and reveal emotions in a less intrusive way than traditional therapy. Ultimately, this workshop is meant to show children that despite the hardships and darkness they face, the night is still bright, starry, and full of hope for the future. 

About ZEITOUNA

With over 2.5 million refugees and 6 million internally displaced persons (IDPs), Syria is now the largest humanitarian crisis of our lifetime. While the brutal living conditions of displacement severely affect all Syrians, the children are the ones to bear the highest trauma of war: lost homes, lost security, lost communities, lost educations. These factors threaten to culminate in lost futures of an entire generation. 

ZEITOUNA, a mentorship program for displaced Syrian children, counters these traumatic factors by rebuilding bonds between mentor and child, rekindling inspiration and creativity, restoring confidence, and reclaiming the innocence of childhood. The program was born out of three simple concepts:

  • EVERY child deserves to play.
  • EVERY child deserves a mentor.
  • EVERY child deserves to be inspired.

Feel free to share this project with friends and family. Thank you for all of your help and support.

story:
Our Story

We are two creatives from Vancouver BC going on a trip to further our careers, expand our networks and share our talents with new audiences. On April 1st we depart from Vancouver headed towards Europe where we will spend 2 weeks in Amsterdam and Barcelona painting, playing music and connecting with local artists. From there we will head south to Cape Town, South Africa where we will be staying at the A Word Of Art Residency program headquarters ( http://www.a-word-of-art.co.za/ ). We will spend 3 weeks in Cape Town where SUEME will be painting murals and also creating a series of paintings for an upcoming show at the AWOA facility. Meanwhile, BIKES will be playing some gigs in Cape Town and most importantly at Afrika Burn, a 5 day community-based art/music festival that takes place in the South African desert.


In addition to the trip itself, and one of the main reasons for the fundraising, is that we would like to document our trip and make a series of videos to share our experiences (similar to the one we did for our recent trip to Miami for Art Basel, see here: http://vimeo.com/34690945 ). Because we are traveling to so many new places far from home, we think it's really important to document our journey to be able to share our exploits with friends, family, fans & sponsors. We don't currently own a camera that shoots video, so that is a rather large expense for us in addition to all of the regular travel costs.


Contribute! 

Both of us currently work as freelance creatives ie: no jobs, so coming up with all of the money to fund a trip of this proportion is a bit of a challenge. With that said, we have already purchased our flights to South Africa, and have saved up a considerable amount to keep us alive. We are not asking to have our whole trip paid for, but we do need help in order to document this trip, produce our video and still have a home to come back to. Some costs we are looking for help with are:

Canon 60D: $1500 (after tax)
Camera case, SD cards, extra batteries, etc: $300
Travel/Flights within Europe: $400
Accommodations (Europe/South Africa): $1200

All In All....

This trip is a huge milestone for us and marks our first visits to either of these continents. The chance to travel to these places and represent our home through our art truly means a lot to us. Your support will contribute to our development and growth as creatives and allow us to share this experience with the world!

All In All....

Your support will contribute to our development and growth as creatives and allow us to share this experience with the world!

story:
A little about me and my work

My name is Dianne Smith. I am a painter, sculptor, installation artist, and cultural worker. I was born and raised in the Bronx, and I now live and work out of my home studio in Central Harlem. 

I use materials in my immediate surroundings to make assemblages. The items I use are things that would ordinarily end up in the trash. My sculptural assemblages are not limited to one particular material as I am using what I have. They are multi-textured and layered with cloth, clothing, hangers, wires, strings, rope, cardboard, dirt, wax, butcher paper and so forth. The assemblages consist of wall hangings, reliefs and stand alone sculptures that may be wrapped and twisted with string, twine and rope.

These (otherwise) discarded materials are part of my inner dialogue--a metaphor for how I view the world. Identity: race, gender, religion, inequity and consumption in a global climate filled with economic despair are all interrelated. Yet, my personhood defines my relationship with each one. Just as it defines the relationship I have with the items I use in my sculptures.

My process is at once organic and incremental. Even as a painter I am not the type of artist that usually creates from a planned paradigm. My forms and shapes are based on the sum of my lived experiences culturally, spiritually and socially. My approach and process is to allow things to unfold, which is also my process when constructing site specific installation out of butcher paper.

www.diannesmithart.com

http://about.me/smithdianne

The Project and Installations

Installation Dates: March 4, 2013 to March 24, 2013

‘Organic Abstracts’ is an exhibition by the West Harlem Art Fund in partnership with the Bartow-Pell Mansion Museum and the City of New York Parks & Recreation department for Armory Week 2013.  

The installation, comprised of two sculptures, showcases a minimalist approach to abstract art, scaled large and reminiscent of works by Henry Moore, who incorporated them into the local landscape and was heavily influenced by non-Western art. The works will not be made from traditional wood or metal but from repurposed materials, offering a more direct and intimate experience for the artist. Viewers will be able to discover the sculptures on the grounds of the Bartow-Pell Mansion Museum, part of the Historic House Trust of NYC. The history of the site,  located in the north Bronx, predates the American Revolution. Located in the city’s largest park, the site was also selected because it is near a wildlife sanctuary, trails, and Orchard Beach. 

http://www.bartowpellmansionmuseum.org

The Couple consists of two heads approximately twenty feet wide and ten feet tall at the highest point resting on one another securely onto a rectangular base. Just as my sculptures, they will be made from everyday discarded materials, like packaging, paper, cans, clothing, magazines, etc. These items will be tightly bound together with string and rope.

The materials and it connectors will create a colorful and textural work of art that will engage the viewer. The Couple represents the idea of environmental, community, and family respect. The idea of heads resting on one another plays on the old adages “two heads are better than one” and  “it takes a village.” They symbolize the thought that we need each other and the environment to live harmonious and balanced lives.Using these objects and connectors allows the viewer to interact with the materials.

For instance, the objects will be visible through the rope and string, thus the viewer will be able to identify things from their everyday life. Allowing the viewer a more personal connection to the sculpture. Sculpting with everyday objects is similar to life: there is no sure thing--something useful one moment is discarded the next. These materials speak to the fragile balance that exists in day-to-day existence, and nature. Thus, it is important to respect, support, and love our communities, families, and environment.

 

Flying High is a site-specific installation constructed out of brown butcher paper. The paper may be crunched, crumpled, rolled, twisted, interlocked, woven, and manipulated and will hang between two trees. Its formations and sunlight will create patterns of shadows, as well as contrast of light and dark, and it will be weather proofed.

Butcher paper for me is a metaphor for the treatment of people in developing countries, particularly those of African descent. It is used for many things and tossed away once we are done. Wrapping meat, crafts, shipping and packing materials are just some of its uses. When we pack things we often push them down, bunching the paper to fill corners, trying to get everything tightly secured and contained. It symbolizes consumption in a global market.

Flying High is also meant to question our ancestral, historical, cultural, and political past, as well as the possibilities for our future. I'd like the viewer to look at the wrinkles in the paper, think about the wrinkles in the skin of the elders in their families: What stories do they tell? What memories do they hold? Look at the ways in which the paper intertwines: How are you connected to your ancestral legacy? Look at the shadows the paper casts: What are your hidden truths? What is the imprint of your personhood on humanity and the environment?

Dianne Smith installations

Why is this project importnt to me?

My journey began when my middle school art teacher in the Bronx encouraged my artistic expression. This, along with the reasons listed below is why this project is so important to me.

  1. It is my first outdoor public art installation!
  2. It is my first exhibition in the Bronx!
  3. It is the first ever contemporary art to be placed on the grounds of Bartow-Pell Mansion in Pelham Bay Park!
  4. It is the first time I am intentionally giving my sculpture human form.

And, it is HISTORIC!

I need your help and support

Although I typically work solely out of my home studio, the scope and scale of this project requires additional work space, as well as assistance. My campaign goal is $8500 and here’s what I hope this campaign will help me with: 

  • Installation & de installation
  • Studio space
  • Marketing, publicity & PR
  • Studio assistant
  • Storage space
  • Transportation
  • Insurance
  • Public programs
  • Materials & supplies

Perks

For your contribution(s) you will receive an original work of art on paper signed and dated by me. They will vary from frameable postcards, to larger unframed works up to approximately 21 x 25. They will be abstarct in various mediums such as: graphite, ink, pastles, oils, watercolor, and collage. In adiition, there will be one original 24 x 24 acrylic on canvas painting available. All of the work offered in this fundraising campaign are at a fraction of the true value.

Perk 3: Pastel Drawing $50

Perk 5: Watercolor Paiting $125

Perk 7: Oil Painting $375

PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD!

Why is public art relevant?

Art is the epoxy that holds a culture together.

Why a public art installation at Bartow-Pell Mansion?

The Bronx is not often thought of as a pastoral place with much natural beauty. Yet, it was once filled with many country estates such as the Bartow-Pell Mansion. By bridging contemporary art, and the rich history of Bartow-Pell Mansion, I want the local community and other visitors to rediscover the spirit and elegance of its natural landscape. The Bronx is also home to many ethnic groups to whom nature is very important. This installation hopes to link the varied cultures, antecedents and Bartow-Pell Mansion’s past to the present, as well as its future in a manner not seen before. Thus creating a lasting imprint on how we all view such a historical site.

I am honored (and I must confess partly terrified) to have been given such a monumental task!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please make some noise about my campaign! You can spread the word by email, facebook, twitter, blogging and so on. You can also donate by PayPal, this way I am able to access funds as soon as they are pledged. This is particularly important since most of the expenses will accrue before the end of the drive. Also it is important to know that you don't have to have a PayPal account to donate to this drive. Please remeber to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you

I want to extend a special thank you to Savona Bailey-Mclain of the West Harlem Art Fund for conceiving of this project. My mom, family and host of friends for their unwavering support; like James Reynolds for giving his time in helping me organize this campaign.

Thank you all so much for your support!

Credits

  1. The Bronx grafitti image: Levys' Unique NY
  2. Music: by Mali Artist Oumou Sangare Moussolou

story:
I’m raising funds to cover the travel expenses to Iceland for an incredible performance/sound artist/documentarian Saskia Delores;  to support  a collaborative process between Saskia and myself and my family while we do a series of artist residencies. 

About this project...

As part of a multi-disciplinary project that I have been working on for more than a year, ‘Solstenen Project’, I am heading to the Western region of Iceland for 5 weeks to do a series of remote artist residencies, with my family -- artist Paul Margolis and our son Hazel Margolis -- where we will all three be working on developing performance-based videos, photography and environmental interventions/installations.  This project is about putting myself as an artist in a radically different place than my comfort zones, using my own body and our private family culture as medium, blending our roles as artists, parents and partners. 

How does Saskia’s contribution come into play?

Thoughout the process of developing this project, I have sought out mentors in other fields to push my work into new territories, into movement/performance, into video/media, writing and sound work.

I had the opportunity to get to know Saskia’s multi-faceted work early in this process when I invited her to join me in a roundtable discussion on “Artists who Interview” when I did an open studio residency at Seattle art center The Project Room for the Solstenen project, to discuss her “Shut Up Dream Crusher" documentary project. 

I also became inspired by her work as a sound and video artist, her ability to transform simple media tools into lush soundscapes and visually intoxicating films.  The main thrust of  Saskia’s artwork is an exploration of where people fail or succeed with the creative process and translating that for all kinds of people.  She is on a mission to encourage the creative efforts of artists (and everyone), to overcome the things that block your growth.   She has been a true mentor in encouraging my movement towards video/sound work.

This spring when I was commissioned by the City of Seattle to create and installation and multi-media performance piece, I immediately asked Saskia to join the team of collaborators.  “Saltus Chori Aevum” was a lush and beautiful success, in no small part to Saskia’s contributions to the score and haunting portarl of “the cutter”. As creative director, working at her side on the sound design, I was incredibly inspired by her desire to show me the ropes of creating sound pieces not unlike the way I build environments. 

I also found my movement practice for the performance piece was so connected to the layered worlds of sound she creates.  Her sound work was like a partner, a guide for developing new ways for me to express my concepts with the movement of my body.

To Iceland!

Saskia and my collaboration on “Saltus Chori Aevum”  was such a period of growth for my plans for what I hoped to accomplish in Iceland with Paul and Hazel.  I knew I wanted to continue to work with Saskia’s sound work in conjunction with the performance work in Iceland; it just seems imperative to the authenticy of the work that she make some of that sound work in Iceland.

When I found out that one of the sites of my residencies had a third bedroom that I wouldn’t need as a studio, it seemed like a golden opportunity to provide that space to another artist, to Saskia. 

We all decided to have faith that we could make this happen on such short notice.  We believe that the people who support our work, believe in what we have done and will continue to do, will support our efforts to make this collaborative process  happen!  With both of us reaching out to all of our supporters, we feel we can make this happen with a collection of very small donations from all of you! 

So we hope your belief or interest in our work will be worth it to you and you will join us to help make this happen!  Even a $2 donation let’s us know you are cheering us on!

You’ll be supporting not just one artist’s project but two!

Saskia plans to make the most of the two weeks she will be joining us!  In addition to working with me to create some of the soundscapes for our films, she also plans to continue in the vein of the “Shut Up Dream Crusher” episode she created about Paul and me (watch above), by create documentary footage of my family as we work on our project, showing the creative process in daily life in a family setting when the parents are artists.

She’ll also have 4 days in Reykjavik alone  and is making plans on meeting Icelandic artists and regular folk and film them talking about their life, dreams, aspirations to continue the “Shutup Dream Crusher” project on an international scale.  And she will continue her experimental street  music and art performance in Iceland, documenting  those performances to be available for online distribution later.

 What you will be helping us pay for!

It is daunting when nearly every book and website about Iceland begins by describing how expensive it is!  But we have a specific goal to meet the budget for transportation costs so they don’t stay on my credit card building interest.  Then we hope you'll help us surpass our goal and give Saskia the ability to focus on working by helping her cover her additional expenses. 

During two weeks, Saskia will be traveling  from Reykjavik to Snaefellsnes peninsula,  to Fljotstunga Farm artist residency, to a night in Hvalfjordur and back to Reykjavik.

This is the breakdown of what you will be supporting by helping us meet our fundraising goals:

airfare  = $1022

rental car costs = $900

donor prizes cost=$100

Fundraising transportation goal is $2022


BUT consider helping us surpass our Goal and help fund Saskia’s expenses, for a total of $2682.  Anything above that will go to fund her time completing her documentary projects.

These are her additional expenses:

$45 bus from Keflavik Airport to Reykjavik

$65 bus from Reykjavik to Snaefellsnes

$50 gas cost from Fljotstunga to Reykjavik

$500, help Saskia live and eat in one of the priciest places to visit!

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

Some people just can’t contribute, we understand, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

1. Help us get the word out and reach beyond our circles of influence.  Please share this fundraising campaign on your social media, your blog, yout twitter.
 
2. Press the 'LIKE' button above and get this campaign to the front page of Indiegogo.com, so we can reach people who don't yet know about our work.
 
And thank you for helping make artist-initiated creative works possible!

story:
EHG is a place for creative play. A place for exploration and experimentation. We believe that Everyone Has Genius and, given the right environment, that genius can present itself and take form.

What started out as an idea for a live/work art space that would allow us to create and present our work in an intense and focused manner quickly turned into an idea for an art space where we could give the same opportunity to our peers, and advocate for creative work of all forms.

EHG is the brain child of Mikey Rioux. He and partners Danielle Hammer, and Kate Bramer bring to the table 20+ years of experience as practitioners and educators in the Arts. The three hold degrees in studio art, dance, art history, and have worked as producers, curators, administrators, and artistic directors. This group not only has the passion and desire but also a knowledge of the real world mechanics that will make EHG a major asset to the Arts community.

As we dive head first into EHG we are asking for your help making the first year of programming a ridiculous success. Meeting our fundraising goal of $50,000.00 would allow us to bring to life 6 gallery exhibitions, 3 performances, numerous film showings, concerts, and lectures and cover most of the years rent. If we raise more than our goal we will be able to start creating our vision for a resource center--a free library and office for working artists, to be used for anything from research to grant writing.

We have some great thank you packages for all of you generous souls willing to contribute to our vision:

VIRTUAL SKIN $1 - $25
You will receive an internet highfive from the EHG team.

WISH YOU WERE HERE $26 - $100
You will receive an internet highfive AND five postcards of original artwork by EHG resident artist Mikey Rioux.

YOU CAN USE THEM AS COASTERS $101 - $500
You will receive an internet highfive, five postcards by artist Mikey Rioux AND a dvd of dance films by select Chicago dance artists AND a cd by experimental musician Mikhail Kaschock.

EHG FUN BOX $501 - $999
You will receive an internet highfive, five postcards by artist Mikey Rioux, a dvd of dance films by select Chicago Dance Artists, a cd by experimental musician Mikhail Kaschock, AND an original drawing.

INSIDE TRACK $1000 - $5000
You will receive the EHG FUN BOX and a season pass to all of our events which includes Gallery openings and closings, performances, film showings, lectures, concerts and whatever else we can dream up. If you do not reside in Chicago you can donate your season pass to someone who does and you will still receive your EHG FUN BOX!

CONCERT FOR... $15000                                                                           ONLY ONE AVAILABLE! The performance art band Singersongrapper will perform a concert in your honor. We will work with you on determining the best date for said concert.

DINNER AND A THEATER... $50000                                                           ONLY ONE AVAILABLE! We will hold a dinner in your honor plus name our performance space in your honor.

 

 

*** If you are unable to contribute financially you can still help us out by spreading the word. Make some noise. HOLLA! Share on facebook, or twitter, or email the campaign to your friends and enemies. (we hope you don’t have any enemies)
story_txt:
EHG is a place for creative play. A place for exploration and experimentation. We believe that Everyone Has Genius and, given the right environment, that genius can present itself and take form.What started out as an idea for a live/work art space that would allow us to create and present our work in an intense and focused manner quickly turned into an idea for an art space where we could give the same opportunity to our peers, and advocate for creative work of all forms.EHG is the brain child of Mikey Rioux. He and partners Danielle Hammer, and Kate Bramer bring to the table 20+ years of experience as practitioners and educators in the Arts. The three hold degrees in studio art, dance, art history, and have worked as producers, curators, administrators, and artistic directors. This group not only has the passion and desire but also a knowledge of the real world mechanics that will make EHG a major asset to the Arts community.As we dive head first into EHG we are asking for your help making the first year of programming a ridiculous success. Meeting our fundraising goal of $50,000.00 would allow us to bring to life 6 gallery exhibitions, 3 performances, numerous film showings, concerts, and lectures and cover most of the years rent. If we raise more than our goal we will be able to start creating our vision for a resource center--a free library and office for working artists, to be used for anything from research to grant writing.We have some great thank you packages for all of you generous souls willing to contribute to our vision:VIRTUAL SKIN $1 - $25You will receive an internet highfive from the EHG team.WISH YOU WERE HERE $26 - $100You will receive an internet highfive AND five postcards of original artwork by EHG resident artist Mikey Rioux.YOU CAN USE THEM AS COASTERS $101 - $500You will receive an internet highfive, five postcards by artist Mikey Rioux AND a dvd of dance films by select Chicago dance artists AND a cd by experimental musician Mikhail Kaschock.EHG FUN BOX $501 - $999You will receive an internet highfive, five postcards by artist Mikey Rioux, a dvd of dance films by select Chicago Dance Artists, a cd by experimental musician Mikhail Kaschock, AND an original drawing.INSIDE TRACK $1000 - $5000You will receive the EHG FUN BOX and a season pass to all of our events which includes Gallery openings and closings, performances, film showings, lectures, concerts and whatever else we can dream up. If you do not reside in Chicago you can donate your season pass to someone who does and you will still receive your EHG FUN BOX!
CONCERT FOR... $15000                                                                           ONLY ONE AVAILABLE! The performance art band Singersongrapper will perform a concert in your honor. We will work with you on determining the best date for said concert.
DINNER AND A THEATER... $50000                                                           ONLY ONE AVAILABLE! We will hold a dinner in your honor plus name our performance space in your honor.
 
 

*** If you are unable to contribute financially you can still help us out by spreading the word. Make some noise. HOLLA! Share on facebook, or twitter, or email the campaign to your friends and enemies. (we hope you don’t have any enemies)

story:
Introduction

Here is our short summary :

  • Threshold Media is founded in November 8, 2013. It is a creative and innovative design house. It consists of six young designers with different professional background.

             

            Rozaimie                                    Iqmal                                      Syakirin
        Manager / Editor             Admin/ Game Layout Design          Admin / Illustrator

                  

                Farah                                      Nasha                                      Syifa                       Finance / Script Writer           Marketing / Monster Illustrator        Finance / Prop Expert



Our Objective

  • We always enhance our skills and to ensures we do the best to our customer. We provide services for art-related products especially books.

  • This book is created with the passion in creating a product to attract children in a new way. Children nowadays seems to be very addicted with current technology that is not good for them so we are trying to solve this by making a comeback of a traditional game combined with pop-up book.

  • Children can feel the joy of playing this game by the realistic feel of this game, which includes the full use of body movement and also can enhance a child's mind. The title of the book is The Goodnight Road.


Our Product


                       

                                            This is The Goodnight Road Book



              

                                               Sneak peek in the story.



                     

                                                 Cute and freaky monster design.


        

                                                      Paper cutting in progress.


 

             Character you can play, there is magnet on their feet so they won't fall.


                    


Our Ads 


    

    

    


 

What We Need & What You Get

We will be needing your support:

  • We will need $3500 as it will support our team in making the product, designs, arts and to help kids to learn in a fun environment

  • We will try our best to make this project a success


Show Support

Please spread the love and support our project:

  • Show support by liking our page in Facebook !

  • Feel free to visit our blog !

  • We also have instagram

  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools too!

Thank you for taking your time visiting our Indiegogo page !

story:
THE KARACHI PROJECT

Welcome to the Karachi Project. 

My name is Hayat Gul, I make glass art canvases, practice the art of henna and am a teacher, based in New Jersey. 

I've been invited to participate in a show called "Zameen" which will be held at the Aman House in Karachi Pakistan, curated by Fatimah Sultan and Fawzia Naqvi in March to End of April.

I have shown my pieces all over the world but this type of work is the most meaningful to me since I have a strong interest in working with destitute kids ever since I did my START residency in Amman, Jordan where I worked with Palestinian kids from the refugee camps in 2010. Although I'm passionate about this kind of work and have witnessed the impact it makes, it gets expensive. 

While in Karachi, I will  use art as a therapeutic tool and create art lessons to encourage the kids to express their emotions through art. These kids would otherwise have no access to quality art education. Please help make this a reality for them. These workshops will take place at the Aman House which is run by the Aman Foundation, a non-profit trust, based and operating in Pakistan inspired  by a proactive commitment to the cause of human development, the Foundation aspires to make strategic interventions in Pakistan to support development in many areas.

http://theamanfoundation.org/

It is also exciting because I was born in Karachi and left when I was 4 so in a way, I look forward to giving something back to my birth country while connecting to my forgotten roots. However, the kids are the most crucial part,since they are the future and will always be! I would happily do the workshops here if invited.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

I would love and appreciate your help with this project and will let the kids know all of your generosity made this happen. I have to cover flight, materials and living expenses for approximately two months. Together we can make an impact by introducing creativity and new perspectives into their world.

Please share with anyone you feel may appreciate this project. I will make a video of the workshops and share on youtube under the name, "The Karachi Project".

www.hayatgul.com

story:
The Situation Gallery is a bi-monthly gallery-on-paper that aims to showcase the work of emerging artists and art critics, discover and highlight new trends in contemporary art, and forge a community between students and young professionals. Founded and curated by Concordia Art History students Katerina Korola and Erika Couto, each issue of Situation Gallery will feature the portfolio of three artists whose work aligns with that issue’s theme alongside four essays by young critics which will provide a critical context for the work. In future issues artists and critics will be selected from submissions, and, in keeping with the project’s ethos to promote work by emerging artists and writers often at the margins of the professional industry, submissions will be open to people of all education levels and backgrounds.

Taking up Situationist International’s call to bring art out of the gallery and into the space of the everyday by creating ‘situations,’ a key element of Situation Gallery is the bi-monthly launch of the magazine. Each launch party will be a ‘situation’ of its own and will include activities aligned with the theme of that issue, incorporating the talents of Concordia student artists. For example, the launch of the first issue, which focuses on illustration in the practice of young artists, will feature live illustrations done by Concordia undergraduate artists Maridza Kim Sarah and Alice Zhang, putting an original work of art inside each magazine. Moreover, launches will be hosted in partnership with different artist-friendly spaces and galleries, which will familiarize and forge connections between Concordia students and local institutions.

Finally, accompanying the print publication, Situation Gallery will also launch an online edition and maintain a blog that highlights local initiatives by Concordia artists, academics, and recent graduates alongside other initiatives by young artists internationally. This website, alongside other social media platforms, will extend the reach of the publication so as to create a network between Concordia-based artists and writers and the larger community of aspiring arts and culture professionals.

story:
Hey everyone. My name is Kyle Laskiewicz and I'm using IndieGogo for something that's really personal to me. Something that I've wanted to do for some time but haven't because of my money situation. First off I'd like to ask for just $1 from any person who reads this. Something small since I know I'm not the only one hard up for money. Thank you.

In October of 2012 I lost my mom. An amazing woman who left behind myself, her husband, and 10 year old son. She had been battling leukemia and kicked it's ass, eventually going into remission. But if you have ever had to deal with cancer or a loved one getting it (I hope none of you have to go through it) then you know how bad the chemo can be more than anything else. And well that's how it ended for her.

I still remember the day like it was yesterday. I was actually at New York Comic Con and called her to ask about going to dinner than night with my girlfriend and I. She sounded sick and said, "no mommy isn't feeling good" in the weirdest way. I knew she was home with my brother (granted he is only 10) and my grandparents live right down the street, so I wasn't that worried. I just thought she had a cold or something since she hadn't looked weak at all recently.

Well with her immune system down from the chemo she went into shock. By the time I got home that night it was too late. We went to the hospital but we lost her that night. Since then nothing has felt right.

Anyway right after she passed away my Pop (her father) got a tattoo of a cross with her name and a son he lost. My immediate plan was to get something for her. I only have one tattoo, but that's just a design with lyrics. Nothing for her. I got it years before. 

Unfortunately I couldn't afford to get a tattoo in her memory. This past year has thrown my family and I curve balls that seem to come at the worst time. But when talking about money I've had bad luck and bills. I'm a broke college kid. I do have a part time job but I have car insurance, a phone bill, and need to pay for gas since I commute. I also had to give up a decent amount of money because during Hurricane Sandy I lost my car. It completely flooded out and got washed away. It's just a car and I didn't get upset since my perspective on life changed greatly after my mom died. It sucked losing it, but it's just a position. I'm just glad she didn't have to go through the pain we all felt after Sandy. She passed away a week or so before it. I forget exactly when Sandy hit.

So it's coming up on the one year anniversary of her death and it hasn't gotten any easier. From her picture in my wallet, to her ashes in a cross around my neck, I always have things to remind me of her. But from the beginning I've wanted to get something more visible to always have on me. Pictures and necklaces can break/get lost. Ink will fade but the image won't. The memory won't.

I feel like now is the perfect time to get something for her. IndieGogo makes me put a minimum of $500 but I don't need that much. If anyone that reads this just throws me $1 then I hope I can get at least $300 to afford something special. 

What do I want? Well one of my best memories of her is growing up and spending so much time playing Super Mario games. I grew up with the NES/SNES and she used to love playing Super Mario Bros. 3 more than anything. We used to take turns and it was just something so special that I'll never forget it. When my brother got a Wii she did the same thing. She truly loved us...but she loved SMB more I think haha.

I don't simply want an orange ribbon for leukemia. No, I want the cover of Super Mario Bros. 3 (Mario flying in a Tanooki suit) with an orange ribbon flowing from his body. I feel like it's unique enough where it's special between just us, and it always represents what she had to go through. The struggle and fight she put up with. 

I somehow want to incorporate lyrics and a possibly a totally different design related to the band Four Year Strong's song "One Step At A Time." The song is about one of the vocalists Dan losing his brother to leukemia. They've been a band who has resonated with me for a decade now, growing up going to shows and what not. The lyrics really hit home for me and I do want to incorporate them somehow. 

Here are the lyrics for the song, and here is the song itself. The lyrics I want are:

"No matter how far the view, I still always look up to you."

This is something I need to do. I miss her every second of every day. It was hard just typing this all. Such a rush of emotions from feeling happy and thinking of good times, to not being able to forget that those times are gone.

So please if you could donate something as small as possible it would help. Like I said, she passed away in late October. It's really hitting me hard more than ever knowing that it's been a full year since I haven't had the most amazing woman in my life. I need to do this to honor her. To remember her. 

Thank you for reading this all. Even if you don't want to contribute to me then please at least look into funding cancer research. My mother dealt with the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society so at least give them some help if you don't want to give me anything. I guess I'm just glad that you read my stories and memories of her. Thank you again.

story:
A LAND OF ENCHANMENT

Ireland is famous for its friendly people, enchanting landscapes, rich culture and melodic music. People have inhabited this island for over 9,000 years. Ireland The Old Country presents my unique vision of the many monuments that have survived the centuries in the rich tapestry of the Irish landscape. From world famous castles to long forgotten ivy clad ruins off the beaten track. I hope that my images will inspire you to come to Ireland again and again and wander down the highways and byways and discover this mystical land of Ireland, The Old Country

  Hello, folks. My name is Patrick Harnett. I am from Limerick City, Ireland. I have worked as a glass artist, set designer, archaeologist, English teacher, and tour guide. Ireland The Old Country is the result of my love for archaeology and art combined. Through my images, I want convey as close as possible the enchantment I feel as I wander around a lonely ivy-clad ruin in an ancient landscape.


BUY THE CALENDAR AND HELP LAUNCH THE BUSINESS

I would love to be able to share my vision with the Irish community here in America, in Ireland and with people from all over the world who love and admire our unique landscape and heritage and culture.

That is why I have decided to produce a calendar of 12 of my favorite images in one package. These include Ireland's most well know and iconic monuments such as Newgrange, Poulnabrone Dolmen, Blarney Castle and many more. The goal of this IndieGoGo project is to raise enough money ($3,500) to print the calendars.

You can donate as little as $5 and receive a large fridge magnet or donate $20 or more and you will receive a 2014 calendar (17" x 11"). The calendar contains 12 images of Irish castles and other improtant monuments. Or you can choose a higher level perk and get stocked up early with beautiful Christmas gifts for all your family, friends, and business associates. Every dollar pitched in will help.

From the responses I’ve already received at Irish festivals and from the nearly 4,000 fans on my Facebook page, I believe I can sell out all the calendars printed well in time for the new year. This will provide seed money to produce further products such as canvas prints, refrigerator magnets, postcards, metal signs, and posters etc. And in turn this will enable me to be a vendor at the many wonderful Irish Festivals around the US of A.

Over time, I hope my work will inspire people to come and visit this wonderful and charming country. I would be ever so grateful if you could help by donating or simply by spreading the word about this project.

Sincerely,
Patrick Harnett

 

Special thanks to Sandy

story:
I have been invited to an artist residency at Arteles Creative Center in Hämeenkyrö, Finland! I will spend 1 month creating new works directly inspired by the residency's surrounding area. I anticipate to add new pieces to my ongoing series New Landscapes and Foliage, which you can see on my website: www.sezabali.com.

Participating to this residency is a wonderful opportunity for me; the residency is in a setting which couldn't be more perfect for my artistic practice (the landscapes of Finland will be crucial elements in the development of my work). I am looking forward to being part of an international artist community. 

In order to support my cost of living and supplies, I am creating a series of photographs to reward those who can contribute to this Indiegogo campaign. A total of $5,000 will help cover my participation to the residency as well as living and art production expenses for one month.

Thank you for your support.

story:
The Skinny

One independent artist with a career that's taking off

Symbolically resonant greeting cards

Recognition of underrepresented relationships

A whole puddle of adorable pups

What You'll Get

All backers receive the following:

A card that sends a meaningful message for your loved one(s)

Free shipping

The satisfaction of helping a developing artist

Finally, in addition to those perks I have three higher tiers available! At $65 I'll draw you your own 8x10 custom work of art, and at $150 you can take home one of the original gallery images! Each original will be retailing for $150 once it's on display, but I wanted to give you all the chance to reserve them at a lower cost as thanks for your support. The originals are first come, first served, so if you've got your eye on one reserve it ASAP. At the highest tier - $500 - you'll be taking home seven cards, your own 8x10 custom work of art, an original gallery image, AND an additional, one of a kind, framed masterpiece of inked glass, crafted to your specifications. Perfect for home offices and other public locations, the translucent materials create a unique atmosphere. While the example below, a portrait of the Christmas demon Krampus, was designed to frighten, glass's unusual properties also lend themselves to scenes of wonder and imagination.

Update: The Platonic Life Partners original has been claimed!

How to order

Last time I launched a campaign I had one option available (later two) - this time I'm offering thirty.

That's right.

Thirty.

Don't worry, it's not as overwhelming as it sounds! I've created fifteen different designs, each depicting a different kind of relationship, with a poem by the magnificent local poet Seven just for the occasion. You can view the full collection of poems here. If you're a dog lover who just wants some sweet pooch cards you also have the option of ordering each design with a poem-less back.

To designate which one(s) you want, just send me a personal message on Indiegogo with the letter of the design, followed by a 1 for poetry and 2 for no poetry, then how many copies of each you'd like to order. For example:

A1, 3 copies = 3 copies of the Self-love card with poetry on the back

Got it? Great! Here are your fifteen sweet pup designs to choose from:

Thank you all once again for your support!

FAQ

I'm not in a good place to order cards right now. How else can I support you?

There's lots you can do to help! First and foremost, spread the news on social media! Word of mouth goes a long way. You can also 'like' my Facebook page, or follow my Instagram for future updates. I also have an Etsy store and a Patreon for my storytelling work.

I love these designs! Can you print my favorite on a poster/mug/other object of my desire?

Most likely! I have all my work printed through a local printer, and they have plenty of options available. Contact me directly and I can get you a price quote.

Can you draw me a <thing>?

Probably! Either sign up for the $65 tier or contact me directly and we'll work something out.

When will my items be shipped?

All cards will be shipped before the end of January! Depending on the quantity and complexity of the commissions I receive I should be able to ship them by then, too. The gallery originals will head your way in March after the show closes.

What is polyamory/all those other words/why are you including friendship here?

Polyamory is the desire for - or engagement in - intimate relationships with more than one partner, with the knowledge and consent of all involved. It can take lots of different shapes, like one person having two partners, or four people who are all involved with each other, but the common factors are the same love and respect you'll find in monogamous relationships. Like all minority groups, polyamorous (poly) people are subject to stereotyping, misunderstandings, and marginalization in mainstream culture.

Along with the cards depicting polyamorous relationships, I've included illustrations of other ways we care about each other. The bonds of friendship can be as tight and enduring as any romance, and even a short-term love affair is worth honoring as real and important.

In addition to some of the more familiar terms (friends with benefits, long-distance relationships) I've added vocabulary and ideas borrowed from the webcomic Homestuck, which is famous for how it honors unconventional relationships. Each of these cards includes an English approximation for clarity.

story:
The Grasshopper at Burning Man 2018

Hello everyone, I'm Elliot and have been going to Burning Man since 2006. Lucky # 13 this year!  I've been bringing a mutant vehicle with some sort of propane out since 2009.  My good friend Kyle that helps me with the fabrication work and assembly has been busy working on new additions to the Grasshopper.  I'm reaching out for help to cover the costs this year with the propane and other expenses we are occurring while adding on to the Grasshopper 2.0.  Nothing beats the looks on peoples faces when we blow off a big one, especially on a cold night.  Any amount contributed will be very much appreciated.  

We are attempting to raise $5,000 to help off set the propane bill/upgrades/transportation.  Both Kyle and I have put in everything we have to get it to this point, and we're asking for your help.  We're currently adding almost 400 feet of LED strip lighting as well.

Propane is typically $3.00 + a gallon.  We have the ability to burn 1000 gallons throughout the event.  Consuming this much fuel enables us to get access to propane on the playa.

We're working on some type of perks to offer and we will update you as soon as we have them finalized.  We're lucky enough to have a CNC plasma artist in our camp working on it.  And don't forget those cold nights when we will be warming the masses with our outrageous flame effects.

If we fall short of our goal, the money raised will go directly to the propane bill and we will be limiting our fuel consumption. 

Please share this campaign and help us get the word out! Thank you for your time.

The Grasshopper team.

story:
Hello,


My name is Kristina Guede. I am the owner of the performance design company, The Off Centered Project. I specialize in circus arts, dance, and character creation based in Atlanta, GA. As a freelance performing artist I am hired for various events of all variety, nationally and internationally.

Two years ago I met Hyun Yong Gin, an amazing body painter and special effects artist, at Living Art America 2016, A North American Body Painting Championship. She creates beautiful works of art and she needs a performing artist to make her work come to life to be presented on a stage. She needed a model for 2017 and loved how I presented the works of art so we decided to start a collaboration. 


Our team won 1st place in the professional category of Living Art America 2017! We had 6 full days of mock competitions before the actual event. That means 6.5 hours of practice for 6 days! It's a great example of practice makes perfect as her piece was a gorgeous tribute to Standing Rock. I created a tribal performance piece to present her art to the audience for the stage presentation of the event. 

From there we have volunteered at Atlanta's branch of the nation wide Unplugged to represent the sense of sight. We created a live art exhibit for four hours while guests silenced their electronics and experienced the senses of life.
We also were invited to Gwanju, South Korea just this past month to give a live special effects makeup demonstration for the Grand Opening of F2MG Global Beauty Academy. 

Now, we are headed to the World Bodypainting Festival in Klagenfurt, Austria on July 26th, 2017 and our team needs your help! 

We are competing in the Purple Brush Award on Friday Night. If won, the piece will tour around the world. 
Plus, we are also competing for the world title in the SPFX Category on Sunday!

This year we have the honor of welcoming Tony Schott to our team. He is a multi award winning gymnast and competitive cheerleader as well as an award winning coach with decades of experience under his belt. He is co-owner of The Off Centered Project and has also switch his emphasis to the performing arts through circus. He will not only be performing but he will also be our SPFX assistant and documenting the magic that is created.

What does this have to do with you?!?!

Well, we need your help to present our artistic collaboration to the world! We only want to go up from here. We have creative works in early stages of development that, in the future, we want to share with our local community but we are trying to build a name for ourselves first and we need your help!

Here is a list of what we are looking to cover with the help of you in order to keep our team in tact! 

-Our apartment! We are staying in an apartment in Klagenfurt, Austria. This is hosting myself (the performing artist), Hyun Yong Gin (the artist) and Tony Schott (SPFX assistant, also a performing artist). We rented an apartment to have a kitchen to be able to purchase food and cook our meals in house. It is much cheaper than eating out! Plus it is equip with a washer so we can pack lighter, huzzah!

-We are also looking for feed the artists funds! Our team meets in Seoul, South Korea for a weeks worth of practice before the competition (remember practice makes perfect) and we are in Klagenfurt, Austria for one week as well. We have kitchens in both locations so we are saving by not eating out!

-We have the majority of the cost being covered for the products we are using to create the spfx pieces but not all! Help us create magic!

- We have most of our travel covered we are looking for final help with trains to travel to and from the airports in Vienna and Venice to Klagenfurt, Austria. 

We are reaching out to have any help we can get and every little bit helps! We want to share our art with the world as the Earth without art is "eh". We are sharing our artistic creations live through multiple social media platforms as well as blogging about the experience as a whole. We want to share our journey with you as is allows everyone to experience something unique and to show you the beauty of the world at the same time. We've created sponsor tiers with perks that I think you'll enjoy! It would mean the world to us if you joined our team.


Artistically yours,
Kristina Guede
The Off Centered Project
Artistic Director | Performer
www.TheOffCenteredProject.com

story:
Un projet d’exposition : Matière à rencontre

Supportez notre cohorte 2019 en métiers d’art et son projet d’exposition dans les disciplines du textile, de l’ébénisterie, de la lutherie et de la sculpture !   C’est une chance pour nos 24 finissants au DEC – Techniques de métiers d’art offert par le Cégep Limoilou  en partenariat avec la Maison des métiers d’art de Québec,  l’Institut québécois d’ébénisterie ainsi que l’École nationale de lutherie de vivre l’expérience d’une toute première exposition dans un cadre professionnel. Avec fierté, ces nouveaux artisans créateurs obtiendront en juin un diplôme en métiers d’art, résultante d’une formation de haut niveau axée sur le savoir-faire manuel, la recherche & création et sur l’entreprenariat.

À travers ces trois ans d’immersion en métiers d’art, ils ont appris à travailler avec une nouvelle matière, à connaître ses forces et ses contraintes, à persévérer pour atteindre un résultat précis, à tisser des liens très singuliers et stimulants avec leurs pairs et leurs enseignants… Trois ans aussi à se dépasser à titre de créateur, à vivre des surprises, des déceptions, à parfois devoir tout recommencer, à s’ébahir, à découvrir les plus grandes et créatives réalisations des artistes de leur domaine, mais surtout, à passer des moments inoubliables en classe-atelier et à vivre leur passion !

Toutes ces réflexions, et le fruit de ce travail vous sera dévoilé du 13 au 19 juin 2019 dans la Salle Multi du Complexe Méduse. Que faire d’ici là ? Nous supporter dans notre campagne de financement afin de faciliter la réalisation de ce beau projet !!

Nous avons besoin de votre soutien !

Nous avons mis en place plusieurs activités de financement afin de rendre possible cet évènement d'envergure. Avec votre aide ainsi que celle de commanditaires et de partenaires, nous espérons amasser 15 000 $ pour notre projet. Jusqu'à maintenant, nous avons récolté plus de 8 000 $ grâce au soutien, en autre, de l'AGEECL.

Nous vous proposons de vous remettre un petit cadeau, en échange de votre don. Nous vous invitons à aller voir les différents items proposés . Toutes vos contributions font la différence !

Vous êtes sans le sou, mais souhaitez nous aider?

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, vous pouvez nous offrir votre soutien en faisant circuler notre projet dans vos réseaux. Toutes vos contributions font la différence !

story:
Weeping Cedar Woman

"Tears streaming from her eyes represent the sorrow she feels at the destruction. The right hand is upheld, to say, 'Stop!' Her left hand points to the Earth, ‘consider nature’."

Godfrey Stephens was inspired to carve the "Weeping Cedar Woman" in 1984 to aid the protest against logging the ancient rain-forests of Meares Island in Clayoquot Sound. 

Carved from a 300 year old wind fall western red cedar from Meares Island, the body and tears are of one piece, hands and feet carved separately and mortised.

After the Meares Island logging protests, the statue was moved to Strawberry Island, where the carving stood for 16 years facing the town of Tofino, B.C.

Historically, politically and culturally significant, Weeping Cedar Woman belongs in Clayoquot Sound. The Tla-o-qui-aht tribal parks have stopped clear-cut logging, considered nature, and offer us a new way forwards!  Lets bring Weeping Cedar Woman home for the 30th anniversary of the tribal park and the logging blockade. 

Individuals and community organizations from Clayoquot Sound are collaborating to bring her home.  The objective is to dedicate the statue on the actual 30th anniversary of the Wah-Nah-Jus/Hilth-hoo-is (Meares Island) Tribal Park declaration, Easter Sunday, April 20th, 2014. This will also mark the start of Earth Week, a celebration with events across the region. 

Weeping Cedar Woman homecoming is a project endorsed by many groups from the Tofino community.  The District of Tofino is supporting this project in important ways, but the money required to purchase the piece from the artist will have to be raised independently.  Only with your help can we bring this conservation icon to Tofino so she can continue to share her wisdom and story. 

The Artist:

Godfrey Stephens is an original and well respected artist from Vancouver Island.  His works are found in many countries, collections and public places, including two monumental carved cedar pieces in the Victoria Press Building.  Parks Canada commissioned him to make a small sculpture, which he presented to Princess Anne when she dedicated Pacific Rim National Park Reserve in May 1971.  He lived and worked in the Tofino / Long Beach area for many years before moving to Victoria and Salt Spring.

What We Need & What You Get

The District of Tofino is looking to provide a permanent home for Weeping Cedar Woman, but a lot still needs to be done to bring Cedar Woman home. Other community groups including Tofino Arts Council and the Pacific Rim Arts Society have agreed to help find funding for signage and dedication costs, but this leaves the acquisition cost to be fundraised. Before launching this campaign roughly 4,000$ of the 20,000$ price tag has already been donated by the community.  Funds raised above and beyond the acquisition costs will be donated to the artist to help with his current major piece called NevermoreWar, a sculpture integrating retired military equipment into a plough share.

As thank you’s the community has come together to offer some perks:

20$ - Signed cards featuring local art or photography

50$ - A Sea Wench travel pack

75$ - A 30th anniversary of Meares Island t-shirt from FOCS

125$ - A print photo of “Eagle” by Tofino Photography

250$ - A print of one of artist Godfrey Stephen's pieces

400$ - A signed 10"-12" print of one of artist Godfrey Stephen's pieces

1000$ a 100$ Gift Certificate to dinner at Sobo’s; an authentic Tofitian dinning experience

The importance of Weeping Cedar Woman

Here are a couple testemonials of the power of the Weeping Cedar Woman, take a look at facebook for more of her significance!

"Come on Canada….Get this amazing piece of West Coast history back to the home where it belongs. Long before Tofino was hip slick and cool..before there was a "Park" and before the tourists took over Godfrey was on the beach at Wreck Bay carving,drawing and painting and his art and history is an important part of Tofinos story . Weeping Cedar Woman is a cornerstone for that history.Bring it back along with the tribute to Godfrey's amazing life and connection to the area."  -  Greg Warnick

"A monumental & historic work by a monumental & historic artist! Lets bring her back to the West Coast where she was created and can once again hear the roar of Mother Pacific." – Rick Jasinski

"I always have loved and respected Weeping Cedar Woman as she truly reflects mother earth. This is a very powerful piece. We truly need to pay more attention and gain more respect to our earth we walk on. Thank you Godfrey." – Bonnie Fontaine

Other Ways You Can Help

Weeping Cedar Woman Home Coming will take a huge community push! We need people to help us spread the word (you can use the handy indiegogo share tools right now!).  We also need people to help us with the actual homecoming event, and  in kind donations to help bring Cedar Woman home are always appreciated.

The District of Tofino also greatly appreciates letters supporting acquisition of this important piece of public art.  Write to the mayor at:

Mayor Josie Osborne

121 3rd Street
PO Box 9
Tofino BC V0R 2Z0
